built with pdoc

pyMBE 

   1class pymbe_library():
   2    """
   3    The library for the Molecular Builder for ESPResSo (pyMBE)
   4
   5    Attributes:
   6        N_A(`obj`): Avogadro number using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry.
   7        Kb(`obj`): Boltzmann constant using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry.
   8        e(`obj`): Elemental charge using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry.
   9        df(`obj`): PandasDataframe used to bookkeep all the information stored in pyMBE. Typically refered as `pmb.df`. 
  10        kT(`obj`): Thermal energy using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. It is used as the unit of reduced energy.
  11    """
  12    import pint
  13    import re
  14    import numpy as np
  15    import pandas as pd 
  16    import json
  17    from scipy import optimize
  18    units = pint.UnitRegistry()
  19    N_A=6.02214076e23    / units.mol
  20    Kb=1.38064852e-23    * units.J / units.K
  21    e=1.60217662e-19 *units.C
  22    df=None
  23    kT=None
  24
  25    def __init__(self, temperature=None, unit_length=None, unit_charge=None):
  26        """
  27        Initializes the pymbe_library by setting up the reduced unit system with `temperature` and `reduced_length` 
  28        and sets up  the `pmb.df` for bookkeeping.
  29
  30        Args:
  31            temperature(`obj`,optional): Value of the temperature in the pyMBE UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
  32            unit_length(`obj`, optional): Value of the unit of length in the pyMBE UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
  33            unit_charge (`obj`,optional): Reduced unit of charge defined using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None. 
  34        
  35        Note:
  36            - If no `temperature` is given, a value of 298.15 K is assumed by default.
  37            - If no `unit_length` is given, a value of 0.355 nm is assumed by default.
  38            - If no `unit_charge` is given, a value of 1 elementary charge is assumed by default. 
  39        """
  40        # Default definitions of reduced units
  41        if temperature is None:
  42            temperature= 298.15 * self.units.K
  43        if unit_length is None:
  44            unit_length= 0.355 * self.units.nm
  45        if unit_charge is None:
  46            unit_charge=self.units.e
  47        self.kT=temperature*self.Kb
  48        self.units.define(f'reduced_energy = {self.kT}')
  49        self.units.define(f'reduced_length = {unit_length}')
  50        self.units.define(f'reduced_charge = 1*e')
  51        self.setup_df()
  52        return
  53    
  54    def activate_motion_of_rigid_object(self, name, espresso_system):
  55        '''
  56        Activates the motion of the rigid object `name` in the `espresso_system`.
  57
  58        Args:
  59            name(`str`): Label of the object.
  60            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
  61
  62        Note:
  63            - It requires that espressomd has the following features activated: ["VIRTUAL_SITES_RELATIVE", "MASS"].
  64        '''
  65        print ('activate_motion_of_rigid_object requires that espressomd has the following features activated: ["VIRTUAL_SITES_RELATIVE", "MASS"]')
  66        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
  67        if pmb_type != 'protein':
  68            raise ValueError (f'The pmb_type: {pmb_type} is not currently supported. The supported pmb_type is: protein')
  69        molecule_ids_list = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].molecule_id.to_list()
  70        for molecule_id in molecule_ids_list:    
  71            particle_ids_list = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
  72            center_of_mass = self.calculate_center_of_mass_of_molecule ( molecule_id=molecule_id,espresso_system=espresso_system)
  73            rigid_object_center = espresso_system.part.add(pos=center_of_mass,
  74                                                           rotation=[True,True,True], 
  75                                                           type=self.propose_unused_type())
  76            for particle_id in particle_ids_list:
  77                pid = espresso_system.part.by_id(particle_id)
  78                pid.vs_auto_relate_to(rigid_object_center.id)
  79        return
  80
  81    def add_bond_in_df(self, particle_id1, particle_id2, use_default_bond=False):
  82        """
  83        Adds a bond entry on the `pymbe.df` storing the particle_ids of the two bonded particles.
  84
  85        Args:
  86            particle_id1 (`int`): particle_id of the type of the first particle type of the bonded particles
  87            particle_id2 (`int`): particle_id of the type of the second particle type of the bonded particles
  88            use_default_bond (`bool`, optional): Controls if a bond of type `default` is used to bond particle whose bond types are not defined in `pmb.df`. Defaults to False.
  89        """
  90        particle_name1 = self.df.loc[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id1].name.values[0]
  91        particle_name2 = self.df.loc[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id2].name.values[0]
  92        bond_key = self.find_bond_key(particle_name1=particle_name1,
  93                                    particle_name2=particle_name2, 
  94                                    use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
  95        if not bond_key:
  96            return
  97        self.copy_df_entry(name=bond_key,column_name='particle_id2',number_of_copies=1)
  98        indexs = self.np.where(self.df['name']==bond_key)
  99        index_list = list (indexs[0])
 100        used_bond_df = self.df.loc[self.df['particle_id2'].notnull()]
 101        #without this drop the program crashes when dropping duplicates because the 'bond' column is a dict
 102        used_bond_df = used_bond_df.drop([('bond_object','')],axis =1 )
 103        if len(used_bond_df.index) > 1: 
 104            used_bond_df = used_bond_df.drop_duplicates(keep='first')
 105        used_bond_index = used_bond_df.index.to_list()
 106        for index in index_list:
 107            if index not in used_bond_index:
 108                self.clean_df_row(index=int(index))
 109                self.df.at[index,'particle_id'] = particle_id1
 110                self.df.at[index,'particle_id2'] = particle_id2
 111                break
 112        return
 113
 114    def add_bonds_to_espresso(self, espresso_system) :
 115        """
 116        Adds all bonds defined in `pmb.df` to `espresso_system`.
 117
 118        Args:
 119            espresso_system (str): system object of espressomd library
 120        """
 121
 122        if 'bond' in self.df.values:
 123            bond_df = self.df.loc[self.df ['pmb_type'] == 'bond']
 124            bond_list = bond_df.bond_object.values.tolist()
 125            for bond in bond_list:
 126                espresso_system.bonded_inter.add(bond)
 127        else:
 128            print ('WARNING: There are no bonds defined in pymbe.df')
 129        
 130        return
 131
 132    def add_value_to_df(self,index,key,new_value, warning=True):
 133        """
 134        Adds a value to a cell in the `pmb.df` DataFrame.
 135
 136        Args:
 137            index(`int`): index of the row to add the value to.
 138            key(`str`): the column label to add the value to.
 139            warning(`bool`, optional): If true, prints a warning if a value is being overwritten in `pmb.df`. Defaults to true.
 140        """
 141        # Make sure index is a scalar integer value
 142        index = int (index)
 143        assert isinstance(index, int), '`index` should be a scalar integer value.'
 144        idx = self.pd.IndexSlice
 145        if self.check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(index=index,key=key):
 146            old_value= self.df.loc[index,idx[key]]
 147            if warning:
 148                if old_value != new_value:
 149                    name=self.df.loc[index,('name','')]
 150                    pmb_type=self.df.loc[index,('pmb_type','')]
 151                    print(f"WARNING: you are redefining the properties of {name} of pmb_type {pmb_type}")
 152                    print(f'WARNING: overwritting the value of the entry `{key}`: old_value = {old_value} new_value = {new_value}')
 153        self.df.loc[index,idx[key]] = new_value
 154        return
 155    
 156    def assign_molecule_id(self, name, molecule_index, pmb_type, used_molecules_id):
 157        """
 158        Assigns the `molecule_id` of the pmb object given by `pmb_type`
 159        
 160        Args:
 161            name(`str`): Label of the molecule type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
 162            pmb_type(`str`): pmb_object_type to assign the `molecule_id` 
 163            molecule_index (`int`): index of the current `pmb_object_type` to assign the `molecule_id`
 164            used_molecules_id (`lst`): list with the `molecule_id` values already used.
 165        
 166        Returns:
 167            molecule_id(`int`): Id of the molecule
 168        """
 169
 170        self.clean_df_row(index=int(molecule_index))
 171        
 172        if self.df['molecule_id'].isnull().values.all():
 173            molecule_id = 0        
 174        else:
 175            # check if a residue is part of another molecule
 176            check_residue_name = self.df[self.df['residue_list'].astype(str).str.contains(name)]
 177            pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]                
 178            if not check_residue_name.empty and pmb_type == pmb_type :              
 179                for value in check_residue_name.index.to_list():                  
 180                    if value not in used_molecules_id:                              
 181                        molecule_id = self.df.loc[value].molecule_id.values[0]                    
 182                        break
 183            else:
 184                molecule_id = self.df['molecule_id'].max() +1
 185
 186        self.add_value_to_df (key=('molecule_id',''),
 187                                index=int(molecule_index),
 188                                new_value=molecule_id, 
 189                                warning=False)
 190
 191        return molecule_id
 192    
 193    def calculate_center_of_mass_of_molecule(self, molecule_id, espresso_system):
 194        """
 195        Calculates the center of mass of type `name`.
 196
 197        Args:
 198            molecule_id(`int`): Id of the molecule to be centered.
 199            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
 200        
 201        Returns:
 202            center_of_mass(`lst`): Coordinates of the center of mass.
 203        """
 204        total_beads = 0
 205        center_of_mass = self.np.zeros(3)
 206        axis_list = [0,1,2]
 207        particle_id_list = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
 208        for pid in particle_id_list:
 209            total_beads +=1 
 210            for axis in axis_list:
 211                center_of_mass [axis] += espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).pos[axis]
 212        center_of_mass = center_of_mass /total_beads  
 213        return center_of_mass
 214
 215    def calculate_HH(self, object_name, pH_list=None, pka_set=None):
 216        """
 217        Calculates the charge per molecule according to the ideal Henderson-Hasselbalch titration curve 
 218        for molecules with the name `object_name`.
 219
 220        Args:
 221            object_name (str): name of the molecule to calculate the ideal charge for
 222            pH_list(`lst`): pH-values to calculate. 
 223            pka_set(`dict`): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}
 224
 225        Returns:
 226            Z_HH (`lst`): Henderson-Hasselbalch prediction of the charge of `sequence` in `pH_list`
 227
 228        Note:
 229            - If no `pH_list` is given, 50 equispaced pH-values ranging from 2 to 12 are calculated
 230            - If no `pka_set` is given, the pKa values are taken from `pmb.df`
 231            - This function should only be used for single-phase systems. For two-phase systems `calculate_HH_Donnan` has to be used.
 232        """
 233        if pH_list is None:
 234            pH_list=self.np.linspace(2,12,50)    
 235        if pka_set is None:
 236            pka_set=self.get_pka_set() 
 237        self.check_pka_set(pka_set=pka_set)
 238        charge_map = self.get_charge_map()
 239        Z_HH=[]
 240        for pH_value in pH_list:    
 241            Z=0
 242            index = self.df.loc[self.df['name'] == object_name].index[0].item() 
 243            sequence = self.df.at [index,('sequence','')]       
 244            if not isinstance(sequence,list):
 245                # If the df has been read by file, the sequence needs to be parsed.
 246                sequence = sequence.replace(' ', '')
 247                sequence = sequence.replace("'", '')
 248                sequence=sequence.split(",")[1:-1]
 249            for name in sequence:
 250                if name in pka_set.keys():
 251                    if pka_set[name]['acidity'] == 'acidic':
 252                        psi=-1
 253                    elif pka_set[name]['acidity']== 'basic':
 254                        psi=+1
 255                    else:
 256                        psi=0
 257                    Z+=psi/(1+10**(psi*(pH_value-pka_set[name]['pka_value'])))                      
 258                else:
 259                    state_one_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.es_type.values[0]
 260                    Z+=charge_map[state_one_type]
 261            Z_HH.append(Z)
 262        return Z_HH
 263
 264    def calculate_HH_Donnan(self, espresso_system, object_names, c_salt, pH_list=None, pka_set=None):
 265        """
 266        Calculates the charge on the different molecules according to the Henderson-Hasselbalch equation coupled to the Donnan partitioning.
 267
 268        Args:
 269            object_names ('lst'): List of the object names of all (potentially) charged molecules in the system.
 270            c_salt ('float'): Salt concentration in the reservoir.
 271            pH_list ('lst'): List of pH-values in the reservoir. 
 272            pka_set ('dict'): {"name": {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}.
 273
 274        Returns:
 275            {"charges_dict": {"name": charges}, "pH_system_list": pH_system_list, "partition_coefficients": partition_coefficients_list}
 276            pH_system_list ('lst'): List of pH_values in the system.
 277            partition_coefficients_list ('lst'): List of partition coefficients of cations.
 278
 279        Note:
 280            - If no `pH_list` is given, 50 equispaced pH-values ranging from 2 to 12 are calculated
 281            - If no `pka_set` is given, the pKa values are taken from `pmb.df`
 282            - If `object_names` does not contain the object names of all (potentially) charged molecules in the system, the calculation will give a wrong result.
 283        """
 284        if pH_list is None:
 285            pH_list=self.np.linspace(2,12,50)    
 286        if pka_set is None:
 287            pka_set=self.get_pka_set() 
 288        self.check_pka_set(pka_set=pka_set)
 289
 290        partition_coefficients_list = []
 291        pH_system_list = []
 292        Z_HH_Donnan={}
 293        concentrations_molecules={}
 294        for key in object_names:
 295            Z_HH_Donnan[key] = []
 296            # Calculate the concentrations of the different types of molecules
 297            concentrations_molecules[key] = (len(self.df.loc[self.df['name'] == key].index) / (self.N_A * self.units.Quantity(espresso_system.volume(), 'reduced_length**3'))).to('mol/liter')
 298
 299        def calc_charges(object_names, pH):
 300            """
 301            Calculates the charges of the different kinds of molecules according to the Henderson-Hasselbalch equation.
 302
 303            Args:
 304                object_names ('lst'): List of the object names of all (potentially) charged molecules in the system.
 305                pH ('float'): pH-value that is used in the HH equation.
 306
 307            Returns:
 308                charge ('dict'): {"molecule_name": charge}
 309            """
 310            charge = {}
 311            for name in object_names:
 312                charge[name] = self.calculate_HH(name, [pH], pka_set)[0]
 313            return charge
 314
 315        def calc_partition_coefficient(charge, concentrations_molecules):
 316            """
 317            Calculates the partition coefficients of positive ions according to the ideal Donnan theory.
 318
 319            Args:
 320                charge ('dict'): {"molecule_name": charge}
 321                concentrations_molecules ('dict'): {"molecule_name": concentration}.
 322            """
 323            nonlocal ionic_strength_res
 324            charge_density = 0.0
 325            for key in charge:
 326                charge_density += charge[key] * concentrations_molecules[key]
 327            return (-charge_density / (2 * ionic_strength_res) + self.np.sqrt((charge_density / (2 * ionic_strength_res))**2 + 1)).magnitude
 328
 329        for pH_value in pH_list:    
 330            # calculate the ionic strength of the reservoir
 331            if pH_value <= 7.0:
 332                ionic_strength_res = 10 ** (-pH_value) * self.units.mol/self.units.l + c_salt 
 333            elif pH_value > 7.0:
 334                ionic_strength_res = 10 ** (-(14-pH_value)) * self.units.mol/self.units.l + c_salt
 335
 336            #Determine the partition coefficient of positive ions by solving the system of nonlinear, coupled equations
 337            #consisting of the partition coefficient given by the ideal Donnan theory and the Henderson-Hasselbalch equation.
 338            #The nonlinear equation is formulated for log(xi) since log-operations are not supported for RootResult objects.
 339            equation = lambda logxi: logxi - self.np.log10(calc_partition_coefficient(calc_charges(object_names, pH_value - logxi), concentrations_molecules))
 340            logxi = self.optimize.root_scalar(equation, bracket=[-1e2, 1e2], method="brentq")
 341            partition_coefficient = 10**logxi.root
 342
 343            charges_temp = calc_charges(object_names, pH_value-self.np.log10(partition_coefficient))
 344            for key in object_names:
 345                Z_HH_Donnan[key].append(charges_temp[key])
 346
 347            pH_system_list.append(pH_value - self.np.log10(partition_coefficient))
 348            partition_coefficients_list.append(partition_coefficient)
 349
 350        return {"charges_dict": Z_HH_Donnan, "pH_system_list": pH_system_list, "partition_coefficients": partition_coefficients_list}
 351
 352    def calculate_initial_bond_length(self, bond_object, bond_type, epsilon, sigma, cutoff):
 353        """
 354        Calculates the initial bond length that is used when setting up molecules,
 355        based on the minimum of the sum of bonded and short-range (LJ) interactions.
 356        
 357        Args:
 358            bond_object (`cls`): instance of a bond object from espressomd library
 359            bond_type (`str`): label identifying the used bonded potential
 360            epsilon (`float`): LJ epsilon of the interaction between the particles
 361            sigma (`float`): LJ sigma of the interaction between the particles
 362            cutoff (`float`): cutoff-radius of the LJ interaction 
 363        """    
 364        def truncated_lj_potential(x, epsilon, sigma, cutoff):
 365            if x>cutoff:
 366                return 0.0
 367            else:
 368                return 4*epsilon*((sigma/x)**12-(sigma/x)**6) - 4*epsilon*((sigma/cutoff)**12-(sigma/cutoff)**6)
 369
 370        epsilon_red=epsilon.to('reduced_energy').magnitude
 371        sigma_red=sigma.to('reduced_length').magnitude
 372        cutoff_red=cutoff.to('reduced_length').magnitude
 373
 374        if bond_type == "harmonic":
 375               r_0 = bond_object.params.get('r_0')
 376               k = bond_object.params.get('k')
 377               l0 = self.optimize.minimize(lambda x: 0.5*k*(x-r_0)**2 + truncated_lj_potential(x, epsilon_red, sigma_red, cutoff_red), x0=r_0).x
 378        elif bond_type == "FENE":
 379               r_0 = bond_object.params.get('r_0')
 380               k = bond_object.params.get('k')
 381               d_r_max = bond_object.params.get('d_r_max')
 382               l0 = self.optimize.minimize(lambda x: -0.5*k*(d_r_max**2)*self.np.log(1-((x-r_0)/d_r_max)**2) + truncated_lj_potential(x, epsilon_red, sigma_red, cutoff_red), x0=1.0).x
 383        return l0
 384
 385    def calculate_net_charge (self, espresso_system, molecule_name):
 386        '''
 387        Calculates the net charge per molecule of molecules with `name` = object_name. 
 388        Returns the net charge per molecule and a maps with the net charge per residue and molecule.
 389
 390        Args:
 391            espresso_system: system information 
 392            object_name (str): name of the molecule to calculate the net charge
 393
 394        Returns:
 395            {"mean": mean_net_charge, "molecules": {mol_id: net_charge_of_mol_id, }, "residues": {res_id: net_charge_of_res_id, }}
 396
 397        Note:
 398            - The net charge of the molecule is averaged over all molecules of type `name` 
 399            - The net charge of each particle type is averaged over all particle of the same type in all molecules of type `name`
 400        '''        
 401        valid_pmb_types = ["molecule", "protein"]
 402        pmb_type=self.df.loc[self.df['name']==molecule_name].pmb_type.values[0]
 403        if pmb_type not in valid_pmb_types:
 404            raise ValueError("The pyMBE object with name {object_name} has a pmb_type {pmb_type}. This function only supports pyMBE types {valid_pmb_types}")      
 405        charge_in_residues = {}
 406        id_map = self.get_particle_id_map(object_name=molecule_name)
 407        def create_charge_map(espresso_system,id_map,label):
 408            charge_map={}
 409            for super_id in id_map[label].keys():
 410                net_charge=0
 411                for pid in id_map[label][super_id]:
 412                    net_charge+=espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).q
 413                charge_map[super_id]=net_charge
 414            return charge_map
 415        net_charge_molecules=create_charge_map(label="molecule_map",
 416                                                espresso_system=espresso_system,
 417                                                id_map=id_map)
 418        net_charge_residues=create_charge_map(label="residue_map",
 419                                                espresso_system=espresso_system,
 420                                                id_map=id_map)       
 421        mean_charge=self.np.mean(self.np.array(list(net_charge_molecules.values())))
 422        return {"mean": mean_charge, "molecules": net_charge_molecules, "residues": net_charge_residues}
 423
 424    def center_molecule_in_simulation_box(self, molecule_id, espresso_system):
 425        """
 426        Centers the pmb object matching `molecule_id` in the center of the simulation box in `espresso_md`.
 427        
 428        Args:
 429            molecule_id(`int`): Id of the molecule to be centered.
 430            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
 431        """
 432        center_of_mass = self.calculate_center_of_mass_of_molecule ( molecule_id=molecule_id,espresso_system=espresso_system)
 433        box_center = [espresso_system.box_l[0]/2.0]*3
 434        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].pmb_type.values[0]
 435        pmb_objects = ['protein','molecule','peptide']
 436        if pmb_type in pmb_objects:
 437            particle_id_list = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
 438            for pid in particle_id_list:
 439                es_pos = espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).pos
 440                espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).pos = es_pos - center_of_mass + box_center
 441        return 
 442
 443    def check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(self, index,key):
 444        """
 445        Checks if a cell in the `pmb.df` at the specified index and column has a value.
 446
 447        Args:
 448            index(`int`): Index of the row to check.
 449            key(`str`): Column label to check.
 450
 451        Returns:
 452            `bool`: `True` if the cell has a value, `False` otherwise.
 453        """
 454        idx = self.pd.IndexSlice
 455        return not self.pd.isna(self.df.loc[index, idx[key]])
 456
 457    def check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(self, name, pmb_type_to_be_defined):
 458        """
 459        Checks if `name` is defined in `pmb.df`.
 460
 461        Args:
 462            name(`str`): label to check if defined in `pmb.df`.
 463            pmb_type_to_be_defined(`str`): pmb object type corresponding to `name`.
 464
 465        Returns:
 466            `bool`: `True` for success, `False` otherwise.
 467        """
 468        if name in self.df['name'].unique():
 469            current_object_type = self.df[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
 470            if  current_object_type != pmb_type_to_be_defined:
 471                raise ValueError ((f"The name {name} is already defined in the df with a pmb_type = {current_object_type}, pymMBE does not support objects with the same name but different pmb_types"))    
 472            return True            
 473        else:
 474            return False
 475
 476    def check_pka_set(self, pka_set):
 477        """
 478        Checks that `pka_set` has the formatting expected by the pyMBE library.
 479       
 480        Args:
 481            pka_set (dict): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}
 482        """
 483        required_keys=['pka_value','acidity']
 484        for required_key in required_keys:
 485            for pka_entry in pka_set.values():
 486                if required_key not in pka_entry.keys():
 487                    raise ValueError('missing a requiered key ', required_keys, 'in the following entry of pka_set', pka_entry)
 488        return
 489
 490    def clean_df_row(self, index, columns_keys_to_clean=["particle_id", "particle_id2", "residue_id", "molecule_id"]):
 491        """
 492        Cleans the columns of `pmb.df` in `columns_keys_to_clean` of the row with index `index` by assigning them a np.nan value.
 493
 494        Args:
 495            index(`int`): Index of the row to clean.
 496            columns_keys_to_clean(`list` of `str`, optional): List with the column keys to be cleaned. Defaults to [`particle_id`, `particle_id2`, `residue_id`, `molecule_id`].
 497        """   
 498        for column_key in columns_keys_to_clean:
 499            self.add_value_to_df(key=(column_key,''),index=index,new_value=self.np.nan, warning=False)
 500        return
 501
 502    def copy_df_entry(self, name, column_name, number_of_copies):
 503        '''
 504        Creates 'number_of_copies' of a given 'name' in `pymbe.df`.
 505
 506        Args:
 507            name(`str`): Label of the particle/residue/molecule type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
 508            column_name(`str`): Column name to use as a filter. 
 509            number_of_copies(`int`): number of copies of `name` to be created.
 510        
 511        Note:
 512            - Currently, column_name only supports "particle_id", "particle_id2", "residue_id" and "molecule_id" 
 513        '''
 514
 515        valid_column_names=["particle_id", "residue_id", "molecule_id", "particle_id2" ]
 516        if column_name not in valid_column_names:
 517            raise ValueError(f"{column_name} is not a valid column_name, currently only the following are supported: {valid_column_names}")
 518        df_by_name = self.df.loc[self.df.name == name]
 519        if number_of_copies != 1:           
 520            if df_by_name[column_name].isnull().values.any():       
 521                    df_by_name_repeated = self.pd.concat ([df_by_name]*(number_of_copies-1), ignore_index=True)
 522            else:
 523                df_by_name = df_by_name[df_by_name.index == df_by_name.index.min()] 
 524                df_by_name_repeated = self.pd.concat ([df_by_name]*(number_of_copies), ignore_index=True)
 525                df_by_name_repeated[column_name] =self.np.NaN
 526            # Concatenate the new particle rows to  `df`
 527            self.df = self.pd.concat ([self.df,df_by_name_repeated], ignore_index=True)
 528        else:
 529            if not df_by_name[column_name].isnull().values.any():     
 530                df_by_name = df_by_name[df_by_name.index == df_by_name.index.min()] 
 531                df_by_name_repeated = self.pd.concat ([df_by_name]*(number_of_copies), ignore_index=True)
 532                df_by_name_repeated[column_name] =self.np.NaN
 533                self.df = self.pd.concat ([self.df,df_by_name_repeated], ignore_index=True)        
 534        return
 535
 536    def create_added_salt (self, espresso_system, cation_name, anion_name, c_salt):    
 537        """
 538        Creates a `c_salt` concentration of `cation_name` and `anion_name` ions into the `espresso_system`.
 539
 540        Args:
 541            espresso_system (`obj`): instance of an espresso system object.
 542            cation_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a positive charge.
 543            anion_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a negative charge.
 544            c_salt (float): Salt concentration. 
 545            
 546        Returns:
 547            c_salt_calculated (float): Calculated salt concentration added to `espresso_system`.
 548        """
 549        cation_name_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==cation_name].state_one.charge.values[0]
 550        anion_name_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==anion_name].state_one.charge.values[0]     
 551        if cation_name_charge <= 0:
 552            raise ValueError('ERROR cation charge must be positive, charge ',cation_name_charge)
 553        if anion_name_charge >= 0:
 554            raise ValueError('ERROR anion charge must be negative, charge ', anion_name_charge)
 555        # Calculate the number of ions in the simulation box
 556        volume=self.units.Quantity(espresso_system.volume(), 'reduced_length**3')
 557        if c_salt.check('[substance] [length]**-3'):
 558            N_ions= int((volume*c_salt.to('mol/reduced_length**3')*self.N_A).magnitude)
 559            c_salt_calculated=N_ions/(volume*self.N_A)
 560        elif c_salt.check('[length]**-3'):
 561            N_ions= int((volume*c_salt.to('reduced_length**-3')*self.N_A).magnitude)
 562            c_salt_calculated=N_ions/volume
 563        else:
 564            raise ValueError('Unknown units for c_salt, please provided it in [mol / volume] or [particle / volume]', c_salt)
 565        N_cation = N_ions*abs(anion_name_charge)
 566        N_anion = N_ions*abs(cation_name_charge)
 567        self.create_particle(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=cation_name, number_of_particles=N_cation)
 568        self.create_particle(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=anion_name, number_of_particles=N_anion)
 569        print('\n Added salt concentration of ', c_salt_calculated.to('mol/L'), 'given by ', N_cation, ' cations and ', N_anion, ' anions')
 570        return c_salt_calculated
 571
 572    def create_counterions(self, object_name, cation_name, anion_name, espresso_system):
 573        """
 574        Creates particles of `cation_name` and `anion_name` in `espresso_system` to counter the net charge of `pmb_object`.
 575        
 576        Args:
 577            object_name(`str`): `name` of a pymbe object.
 578            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
 579            cation_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a positive charge.
 580            anion_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a negative charge.
 581
 582        Returns: 
 583            counterion_number (dict): {"name": number}
 584        """
 585        cation_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==cation_name].state_one.charge.iloc[0]
 586        anion_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==anion_name].state_one.charge.iloc[0]
 587        object_ids = self.get_particle_id_map(object_name=object_name)["all"]
 588        counterion_number={}
 589        object_charge={}
 590        for name in ['positive', 'negative']:
 591            object_charge[name]=0
 592        for id in object_ids:
 593            if espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q > 0:
 594                object_charge['positive']+=1*(self.np.abs(espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q ))
 595            elif espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q < 0:
 596                object_charge['negative']+=1*(self.np.abs(espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q ))
 597        if (object_charge['positive'] % abs(anion_charge) == 0):
 598            counterion_number[anion_name]=int(object_charge['positive']/abs(anion_charge))
 599        else:
 600            raise ValueError('The number of positive charges in the pmb_object must be divisible by the  charge of the anion')
 601        if (object_charge['negative'] % abs(cation_charge) == 0):
 602            counterion_number[cation_name]=int(object_charge['negative']/cation_charge)
 603        else:
 604            raise ValueError('The number of negative charges in the pmb_object must be divisible by the  charge of the cation')
 605        if counterion_number[cation_name] > 0: 
 606            self.create_particle(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=cation_name, number_of_particles=counterion_number[cation_name])
 607        else:
 608            counterion_number[cation_name]=0
 609        if counterion_number[anion_name] > 0:
 610            self.create_particle(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=anion_name, number_of_particles=counterion_number[anion_name])
 611        else:
 612            counterion_number[anion_name] = 0
 613        print('The following counter-ions have been created: ')
 614        for name in counterion_number.keys():
 615            print(f'Ion type: {name} created number: {counterion_number[name]}')
 616        return counterion_number
 617
 618    def create_molecule(self, name, number_of_molecules, espresso_system, first_residue_position=None, use_default_bond=False):
 619        """
 620        Creates `number_of_molecules` molecule of type `name` into `espresso_system` and bookkeeps them into `pmb.df`.
 621
 622        Args:
 623            name(`str`): Label of the molecule type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
 624            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from espressomd library.
 625            number_of_molecules(`int`): Number of molecules of type `name` to be created.
 626            first_residue_position(`list`, optional): coordinates where the first_residue_position will be created, random by default
 627            use_default_bond(`bool`, optional): Controls if a bond of type `default` is used to bond particle with undefined bonds in `pymbe.df`
 628        Returns:
 629            molecules_info (`dict`):  {molecule_id: {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids": [particle_id1, ...]}}} 
 630        """
 631        if number_of_molecules <= 0:
 632            return
 633        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,
 634                                                    pmb_type_to_be_defined='molecule'):
 635            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a label of a pmb_type='molecule' defined on df")
 636        first_residue = True
 637        molecule_info = []
 638        residue_list = self.df[self.df['name']==name].residue_list.values [0]
 639
 640        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,
 641                        column_name='molecule_id',
 642                        number_of_copies=number_of_molecules)
 643        
 644        molecules_index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
 645        molecule_index_list =list(molecules_index[0])[-number_of_molecules:]
 646        used_molecules_id = self.df.molecule_id.dropna().drop_duplicates().tolist()
 647
 648        for molecule_index in molecule_index_list:         
 649
 650            molecule_id = self.assign_molecule_id (name=name,pmb_type='molecule',used_molecules_id=used_molecules_id,molecule_index=molecule_index)
 651
 652            for residue in residue_list:
 653                if first_residue:
 654                    residue_position = first_residue_position
 655                    backbone_vector = self.generate_trialvectors(center=[0,0,0], 
 656                                                                 radius=1, 
 657                                                                 n_samples=1,
 658                                                                 on_surface=True)[0]
 659                    residues_info = self.create_residue(name=residue,
 660                                                                    number_of_residues=1, 
 661                                                                    espresso_system=espresso_system, 
 662                                                                    central_bead_position=first_residue_position,  
 663                                                                    use_default_bond= use_default_bond, 
 664                                                                    backbone_vector=backbone_vector)
 665                    residue_id = next(iter(residues_info))
 666                    for index in self.df[self.df['residue_id']==residue_id].index:
 667                        self.add_value_to_df(key=('molecule_id',''),
 668                                            index=int (index),
 669                                            new_value=molecule_id)
 670                    central_bead_id = residues_info[residue_id]['central_bead_id']
 671                    previous_residue = residue
 672                    residue_position = espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).pos
 673                    previous_residue_id = central_bead_id
 674                    first_residue = False          
 675                else:                    
 676                    previous_central_bead_name=self.df[self.df['name']==previous_residue].central_bead.values[0]
 677                    new_central_bead_name=self.df[self.df['name']==residue].central_bead.values[0]       
 678                    bond = self.search_bond(particle_name1=previous_central_bead_name, 
 679                                            particle_name2=new_central_bead_name, 
 680                                            hard_check=True, 
 681                                            use_default_bond=use_default_bond)                
 682                    l0 = self.get_bond_length(particle_name1=previous_central_bead_name, 
 683                                              particle_name2=new_central_bead_name, 
 684                                              hard_check=True, 
 685                                              use_default_bond=use_default_bond)                
 686                    residue_position = residue_position+backbone_vector*l0
 687                    residues_info = self.create_residue(name=residue, 
 688                                                                    number_of_residues=1, 
 689                                                                    espresso_system=espresso_system, 
 690                                                                    central_bead_position=[residue_position],
 691                                                                    use_default_bond= use_default_bond)
 692                    residue_id = next(iter(residues_info))      
 693                    for index in self.df[self.df['residue_id']==residue_id].index:
 694                        if not self.check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(index=index,key=('molecule_id','')):
 695                            self.df.at[index,'molecule_id'] = molecule_id
 696                            self.add_value_to_df(key=('molecule_id',''),
 697                                                index=int (index),
 698                                                new_value=molecule_id,
 699                                                warning=False)            
 700                    central_bead_id = residues_info[residue_id]['central_bead_id']
 701                    espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).add_bond((bond, previous_residue_id))
 702                    self.add_bond_in_df(particle_id1=central_bead_id,
 703                                        particle_id2=previous_residue_id,
 704                                        use_default_bond=use_default_bond)            
 705                    previous_residue_id = central_bead_id
 706                    previous_residue = residue                    
 707                molecule_info.append(residues_info)
 708            first_residue = True
 709        return molecule_info
 710    
 711    def create_particle(self, name, espresso_system, number_of_particles, position=None, fix=False):
 712        """
 713        Creates `number_of_particles` particles of type `name` into `espresso_system` and bookkeeps them into `pymbe.df`.
 714        
 715        Args:
 716            name (`str`): Label of the particle type to be created. `name` must be a `particle` defined in `pmb_df`. 
 717            espresso_system (`cls`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
 718            number_of_particles (`int`): Number of particles to be created.
 719            position (list of [`float`,`float`,`float`], optional): Initial positions of the particles. If not given, particles are created in random positions. Defaults to None.
 720            fix(`bool`, optional): Controls if the particle motion is frozen in the integrator, it is used to create rigid objects. Defaults to False.
 721        Returns:
 722            created_pid_list(`list` of `float`): List with the ids of the particles created into `espresso_system`.
 723        """       
 724        if number_of_particles <=0:
 725            return
 726        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='particle'):
 727            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a label of a pmb_type='particle' defined on df")
 728        # Copy the data of the particle `number_of_particles` times in the `df`
 729        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,column_name='particle_id',number_of_copies=number_of_particles)
 730        # Get information from the particle type `name` from the df     
 731        q = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.charge.values[0]
 732        es_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.es_type.values[0]
 733        # Get a list of the index in `df` corresponding to the new particles to be created
 734        index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
 735        index_list =list(index[0])[-number_of_particles:]
 736        # Create the new particles into  `espresso_system`
 737        created_pid_list=[]
 738        for index in range (number_of_particles):
 739            df_index=int (index_list[index])
 740            self.clean_df_row(index=df_index)
 741            if position is None:
 742                particle_position = self.np.random.random((1, 3))[0] *self.np.copy(espresso_system.box_l)
 743            else:
 744                particle_position = position[index]
 745            if len(espresso_system.part.all()) == 0:
 746                bead_id = 0
 747            else:
 748                bead_id = max (espresso_system.part.all().id) + 1
 749            created_pid_list.append(bead_id)
 750            
 751            if fix:
 752                espresso_system.part.add (id=bead_id, pos = particle_position, type = es_type, q = q,fix =[fix,fix,fix])        
 753            else:
 754                espresso_system.part.add (id=bead_id, pos = particle_position, type = es_type, q = q)        
 755            self.add_value_to_df(key=('particle_id',''),index=df_index,new_value=bead_id, warning=False)                  
 756        return created_pid_list
 757
 758    def create_pmb_object (self, name, number_of_objects, espresso_system, position=None, use_default_bond=False):
 759        """
 760        Creates all `particle`s associated to `pmb object` into  `espresso` a number of times equal to `number_of_objects`.
 761        
 762        Args:
 763            name(`str`): Unique label of the `pmb object` to be created. 
 764            number_of_objects(`int`): Number of `pmb object`s to be created.
 765            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of an espresso system object from espressomd library.
 766            position(`list`): Coordinates where the particles should be created.
 767            use_default_bond(`bool`,optional): Controls if a `default` bond is used to bond particles with undefined bonds in `pmb.df`. Defaults to `False`.
 768
 769        Note:
 770            - If no `position` is given, particles will be created in random positions. For bonded particles, they will be created at a distance equal to the bond length. 
 771        """
 772        allowed_objects=['particle','residue','molecule']
 773        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
 774        if pmb_type not in allowed_objects:
 775            raise ValueError('Object type not supported, supported types are ', allowed_objects)
 776        if pmb_type == 'particle':
 777            self.create_particle(name=name, number_of_particles=number_of_objects, espresso_system=espresso_system, position=position)
 778        elif pmb_type == 'residue':
 779            self.create_residue(name=name,number_of_residues=number_of_objects, espresso_system=espresso_system, central_bead_position=position,use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 780        elif pmb_type == 'molecule':
 781            self.create_molecule(name=name,number_of_molecules=number_of_objects, espresso_system=espresso_system, use_default_bond=use_default_bond, first_residue_position=position)
 782        return
 783
 784    def create_protein(self, name, number_of_proteins, espresso_system, topology_dict):
 785        """
 786        Creates `number_of_proteins` molecules of type `name` into `espresso_system` at the coordinates in `positions`
 787
 788        Args:
 789            name(`str`): Label of the protein to be created. 
 790            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
 791            number_of_proteins(`int`): Number of proteins to be created.
 792            positions(`dict`): {'ResidueNumber': {'initial_pos': [], 'chain_id': ''}}
 793        """
 794
 795        if number_of_proteins <=0:
 796            return
 797        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,
 798                                                  pmb_type_to_be_defined='protein'):
 799            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a name of a pmb_type='protein' defined on df")
 800
 801        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,column_name='molecule_id',number_of_copies=number_of_proteins)
 802
 803        protein_index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
 804        protein_index_list =list(protein_index[0])[-number_of_proteins:]
 805        used_molecules_id = self.df.molecule_id.dropna().drop_duplicates().tolist()
 806        
 807        box_half=espresso_system.box_l[0]/2.0
 808
 809        for molecule_index in protein_index_list:     
 810
 811            molecule_id = self.assign_molecule_id (name=name,pmb_type='protein',used_molecules_id=used_molecules_id,molecule_index=molecule_index)
 812
 813            protein_center = self.generate_coordinates_outside_sphere(radius = 1, 
 814                                                                        max_dist=box_half, 
 815                                                                        n_samples=1, 
 816                                                                        center=[box_half]*3)[0]
 817   
 818            for residue in topology_dict.keys():
 819
 820                residue_name = self.re.split(r'\d+', residue)[0]
 821                residue_number = self.re.split(r'(\d+)', residue)[1]
 822                residue_position = topology_dict[residue]['initial_pos']
 823                position = residue_position + protein_center
 824
 825                particle_id = self.create_particle(name=residue_name,
 826                                                            espresso_system=espresso_system,
 827                                                            number_of_particles=1,
 828                                                            position=[position], 
 829                                                            fix = True)
 830
 831                index = self.df[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id[0]].index.values[0]
 832
 833                self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
 834                                            index=int (index),
 835                                            new_value=residue_number)
 836
 837                self.add_value_to_df(key=('molecule_id',''),
 838                                        index=int (index),
 839                                        new_value=molecule_id)
 840
 841        return
 842
 843    def create_residue(self, name, espresso_system, number_of_residues, central_bead_position=None,use_default_bond=False, backbone_vector=None):
 844        """
 845        Creates `number_of_residues` residues of type `name` into `espresso_system` and bookkeeps them into `pmb.df`.
 846
 847        Args:
 848            name(`str`): Label of the residue type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
 849            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from espressomd library.
 850            number_of_residue(`int`): Number of residues of type `name` to be created.
 851            central_bead_position(`list` of `float`): Position of the central bead.
 852            use_default_bond (`bool`): Switch to control if a bond of type `default` is used to bond a particle whose bonds types are not defined in `pmb.df`
 853            backbone_vector (`list` of `float`): Backbone vector of the molecule. All side chains are created perpendicularly to `backbone_vector`.
 854
 855        Returns:
 856            residues_info (`dict`): {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids":[particle_id1, ...]}}
 857        """
 858        if number_of_residues <= 0:
 859            return
 860        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,
 861                                                    pmb_type_to_be_defined='residue'):
 862            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a label of a pmb_type='residue' defined on df")
 863        # Copy the data of a residue a `number_of_residues` times in the `df
 864        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,
 865                            column_name='residue_id',
 866                            number_of_copies=number_of_residues)
 867        residues_index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
 868        residue_index_list =list(residues_index[0])[-number_of_residues:]
 869        # Internal bookkepping of the residue info (important for side-chain residues)
 870        # Dict structure {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids":[particle_id1, ...]}}
 871        residues_info={}
 872        for residue_index in residue_index_list:     
 873            self.clean_df_row(index=int(residue_index))
 874            # Assign a residue_id
 875            if self.df['residue_id'].isnull().all():
 876                residue_id=0
 877            else:
 878                residue_id = self.df['residue_id'].max() + 1
 879            self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),index=int (residue_index),new_value=residue_id, warning=False)
 880            # create the principal bead
 881            if self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].central_bead.values[0] is self.np.NaN:
 882                raise ValueError("central_bead must contain a particle name")        
 883            central_bead_name = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].central_bead.values[0]            
 884            central_bead_id = self.create_particle(name=central_bead_name,
 885                                                                espresso_system=espresso_system,
 886                                                                position=central_bead_position,
 887                                                                number_of_particles = 1)[0]
 888            central_bead_position=espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).pos
 889            #assigns same residue_id to the central_bead particle created.
 890            index = self.df[self.df['particle_id']==central_bead_id].index.values[0]
 891            self.df.at [index,'residue_id'] = residue_id
 892            # Internal bookkeeping of the central bead id
 893            residues_info[residue_id]={}
 894            residues_info[residue_id]['central_bead_id']=central_bead_id
 895            # create the lateral beads  
 896            side_chain_list = self.df.loc[self.df.index[residue_index]].side_chains.values[0]
 897            side_chain_beads_ids = []
 898            for side_chain_element in side_chain_list:
 899                if side_chain_element not in self.df.values:              
 900                        raise ValueError (side_chain_element +'is not defined')
 901                pmb_type = self.df[self.df['name']==side_chain_element].pmb_type.values[0] 
 902                if pmb_type == 'particle':
 903                    bond = self.search_bond(particle_name1=central_bead_name, 
 904                                            particle_name2=side_chain_element, 
 905                                            hard_check=True, 
 906                                            use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 907                    l0 = self.get_bond_length(particle_name1=central_bead_name, 
 908                                              particle_name2=side_chain_element, 
 909                                              hard_check=True, 
 910                                              use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 911                    if backbone_vector is None:
 912                        bead_position=self.generate_trialvectors(center=central_bead_position, 
 913                                                                 radius=l0, 
 914                                                                 n_samples=1,
 915                                                                 on_surface=True)[0]
 916                    else:
 917                        bead_position=self.generate_trial_perpendicular_vector(vector=backbone_vector,
 918                                                                            center=central_bead_position, 
 919                                                                            radius=l0)
 920                        
 921                    side_bead_id = self.create_particle(name=side_chain_element, 
 922                                                                    espresso_system=espresso_system,
 923                                                                    position=[bead_position], 
 924                                                                    number_of_particles=1)[0]
 925                    index = self.df[self.df['particle_id']==side_bead_id].index.values[0]
 926                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
 927                                        index=int (index),
 928                                        new_value=residue_id, 
 929                                        warning=False)
 930                    side_chain_beads_ids.append(side_bead_id)
 931                    espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).add_bond((bond, side_bead_id))
 932                    self.add_bond_in_df(particle_id1=central_bead_id,
 933                                        particle_id2=side_bead_id,
 934                                        use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 935                elif pmb_type == 'residue':
 936                    central_bead_side_chain = self.df[self.df['name']==side_chain_element].central_bead.values[0]
 937                    bond = self.search_bond(particle_name1=central_bead_name, 
 938                                            particle_name2=central_bead_side_chain, 
 939                                            hard_check=True, 
 940                                            use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 941                    l0 = self.get_bond_length(particle_name1=central_bead_name, 
 942                                              particle_name2=central_bead_side_chain, 
 943                                              hard_check=True, 
 944                                              use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 945                    if backbone_vector is None:
 946                        residue_position=self.generate_trialvectors(center=central_bead_position, 
 947                                                                    radius=l0, 
 948                                                                    n_samples=1,
 949                                                                    on_surface=True)[0]
 950                    else:
 951                        residue_position=self.generate_trial_perpendicular_vector(vector=backbone_vector,
 952                                                                                center=central_bead_position, 
 953                                                                                radius=l0)
 954                    lateral_residue_info = self.create_residue(name=side_chain_element, espresso_system=espresso_system,
 955                        number_of_residues=1, central_bead_position=[residue_position],use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 956                    lateral_residue_dict=list(lateral_residue_info.values())[0]
 957                    central_bead_side_chain_id=lateral_residue_dict['central_bead_id']
 958                    lateral_beads_side_chain_ids=lateral_residue_dict['side_chain_ids']
 959                    residue_id_side_chain=list(lateral_residue_info.keys())[0]
 960                    # Change the residue_id of the residue in the side chain to the one of the biger residue
 961                    index = self.df[(self.df['residue_id']==residue_id_side_chain) & (self.df['pmb_type']=='residue') ].index.values[0]
 962                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
 963                                        index=int(index),
 964                                        new_value=residue_id, 
 965                                        warning=False)
 966                    # Change the residue_id of the particles in the residue in the side chain
 967                    side_chain_beads_ids+=[central_bead_side_chain_id]+lateral_beads_side_chain_ids
 968                    for particle_id in side_chain_beads_ids:
 969                        index = self.df[(self.df['particle_id']==particle_id) & (self.df['pmb_type']=='particle')].index.values[0]
 970                        self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
 971                                            index=int (index),
 972                                            new_value=residue_id, 
 973                                            warning=False)
 974                    espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).add_bond((bond, central_bead_side_chain_id))
 975                    self.add_bond_in_df(particle_id1=central_bead_id,
 976                                        particle_id2=central_bead_side_chain_id,
 977                                        use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 978            # Internal bookkeeping of the side chain beads ids
 979            residues_info[residue_id]['side_chain_ids']=side_chain_beads_ids
 980        return  residues_info
 981
 982    def create_variable_with_units(self, variable_dict):
 983        """
 984        Returns a pint object with the value and units defined in `variable_dict`.
 985
 986        Args:
 987            variable_dict(`dict`): {'value': value, 'units': units}
 988        Returns:
 989            variable_with_units(`obj`): variable with units using the pyMBE UnitRegistry.
 990        """        
 991        value=variable_dict.pop('value')
 992        units=variable_dict.pop('units')
 993        variable_with_units=value*self.units(units)
 994
 995        return variable_with_units
 996
 997    def define_AA_particles_in_sequence(self, sequence):
 998        '''
 999        Defines in `pmb.df` all the different particles in `sequence`.
1000
1001        Args:
1002            sequence(`lst`):  Sequence of the peptide or protein. 
1003
1004        Note:
1005            - It assumes that the names in `sequence` correspond to amino acid names using the standard one letter code.
1006        '''
1007
1008        already_defined_AA=[]
1009        acidic_aminoacids = ['c','E','D','Y','C']
1010        basic_aminoacids  = ['R','n','K','H']
1011
1012        for residue_name in sequence:
1013            if residue_name in already_defined_AA:
1014                continue
1015            if residue_name in acidic_aminoacids:
1016                self.define_particle (name=residue_name, acidity='acidic')
1017            elif residue_name in basic_aminoacids:
1018                self.define_particle (name=residue_name, acidity='basic')
1019            else:
1020                self.define_particle (name=residue_name, q=0)
1021        return 
1022
1023    def define_AA_residues(self, sequence, model):
1024        """
1025        Defines in `pmb.df` all the different residues in `sequence`.
1026
1027        Args:
1028            sequence(`lst`):  Sequence of the peptide or protein.
1029            model (`string`): Model name. Currently only models with 1 bead '1beadAA' or with 2 beads '2beadAA' per amino acid are supported.
1030
1031        Returns:
1032            residue_list (`list` of `str`): List of the `name`s of the `residue`s  in the sequence of the `molecule`.             
1033        """
1034        residue_list = []
1035        for residue_name in sequence:
1036            if model == '1beadAA':
1037                central_bead = residue_name
1038                side_chains = []
1039            elif model == '2beadAA':
1040                if residue_name in ['c','n', 'G']: 
1041                    central_bead = residue_name
1042                    side_chains = []
1043                else:
1044                    central_bead = 'CA'              
1045                    side_chains = [residue_name]
1046            if residue_name not in residue_list:   
1047                self.define_residue(name = 'AA-'+residue_name, 
1048                                    central_bead = central_bead,
1049                                    side_chains = side_chains)              
1050            residue_list.append('AA-'+residue_name)
1051        return residue_list
1052 
1053    def define_bond(self, bond_object, bond_type, particle_name1, particle_name2):
1054        """
1055        Defines a pmb object of type `bond` in `pymbe.df`
1056        
1057        Args:
1058            bond_object (`cls`): instance of a bond object from espressomd library
1059            bond_type (`str`): label identifying the used bonded potential
1060            particle_name1 (`str`): `name` of the first `particle` to be bonded.
1061            particle_name2 (`str`): `name` of the second `particle` to be bonded.
1062        
1063        Note:
1064            - Currently, only harmonic and FENE bonds are supported.
1065        """    
1066        
1067        valid_bond_types=["harmonic", "FENE"]
1068        if bond_type not in valid_bond_types:
1069                       raise ValueError(f"Bond type {bond_type} currently not implemented in pyMBE, valid types are {valid_bond_types}")
1070
1071        lj_parameters=self.get_lj_parameters(particle_name1=particle_name1, 
1072                                        particle_name2=particle_name2, 
1073                                        combining_rule='Lorentz-Berthelot')
1074
1075        cutoff = 2**(1.0/6.0) * lj_parameters["sigma"]
1076        l0 = self.calculate_initial_bond_length(bond_object=bond_object, 
1077                                                bond_type=bond_type, 
1078                                                epsilon=lj_parameters["epsilon"],
1079                                                sigma=lj_parameters["sigma"],
1080                                                cutoff=cutoff)
1081
1082        index = len(self.df)
1083        for label in [particle_name1+'-'+particle_name2,particle_name2+'-'+particle_name1]:
1084            self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=label, pmb_type_to_be_defined="bond")
1085        self.df.at [index,'name']= particle_name1+'-'+particle_name2
1086        self.df.at [index,'bond_object'] = bond_object
1087        self.df.at [index,'l0'] = l0
1088        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1089                                key=('pmb_type',''),
1090                                new_value='bond')
1091        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1092                                key=('parameters_of_the_potential',''),
1093                                new_value=self.json.dumps(bond_object.get_params()))
1094        return
1095
1096    def define_default_bond(self, bond_object, bond_type, epsilon=None, sigma=None, cutoff=None):
1097        """
1098        Asigns `bond` in `pmb.df` as the default bond.
1099        The LJ parameters can be optionally provided to calculate the initial bond length
1100
1101        Args:
1102            bond (`obj`): instance of a bond object from the espressomd library.
1103            bond_type (`str`): label identifying the used bonded potential
1104            sigma (`float`, optional): LJ sigma of the interaction between the particles
1105            epsilon (`float`, optional): LJ epsilon for the interaction between the particles
1106            cutoff (`float`, optional): cutoff-radius of the LJ interaction
1107
1108        Note:
1109            - Currently, only harmonic and FENE bonds are supported. 
1110        """
1111        valid_bond_types=["harmonic", "FENE"]
1112        if bond_type not in valid_bond_types:
1113            raise ValueError(f"Bond type {bond_type} currently not implemented in pyMBE, valid types are {valid_bond_types}")
1114        if epsilon is None:
1115            epsilon=1*self.units('reduced_energy')
1116        if sigma is None:
1117            sigma=1*self.units('reduced_length')
1118        if cutoff is None:
1119            cutoff=2**(1.0/6.0)*self.units('reduced_length')
1120        l0 = self.calculate_initial_bond_length(bond_object=bond_object, 
1121                                                bond_type=bond_type, 
1122                                                epsilon=epsilon,
1123                                                sigma=sigma,
1124                                                cutoff=cutoff)
1125
1126        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name='default',pmb_type_to_be_defined='bond'):
1127            return
1128        if len(self.df.index) != 0:
1129            index = max(self.df.index)+1
1130        else:
1131            index = 0
1132        self.df.at [index,'name'] = 'default'
1133        self.df.at [index,'bond_object'] = bond_object
1134        self.df.at [index,'l0'] = l0
1135        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1136                            key=('pmb_type',''),
1137                            new_value='bond')
1138        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1139                            key=('parameters_of_the_potential',''),
1140                            new_value=self.json.dumps(bond_object.get_params()))
1141        return
1142
1143    def define_epsilon_value_of_particles(self, eps_dict):
1144        '''
1145        Defines the epsilon value of the particles in `eps_dict` into the `pmb.df`.
1146
1147        Args:
1148            eps_dict(`dict`):  {'name': epsilon}
1149        '''
1150        for residue in eps_dict.keys():
1151            label_list = self.df[self.df['name'] == residue].index.tolist()
1152            for index in label_list:
1153                epsilon = eps_dict[residue]
1154                self.add_value_to_df(key= ('epsilon',''),
1155                        index=int (index),
1156                        new_value=epsilon)
1157        return 
1158
1159    def define_molecule(self, name, residue_list):
1160        """
1161        Defines a pyMBE object of type `molecule` in `pymbe.df`.
1162
1163        Args:
1164            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `molecule`.
1165            residue_list (`list` of `str`): List of the `name`s of the `residue`s  in the sequence of the `molecule`.  
1166        """
1167        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='molecule'):
1168            return
1169        index = len(self.df)
1170        self.df.at [index,'name'] = name
1171        self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'molecule'
1172        self.df.at [index,('residue_list','')] = residue_list
1173        return
1174
1175    def define_particle(self, name, q=0, diameter=None, acidity='inert', epsilon=None, pka=None):
1176        """
1177        Defines a pyMBE object of type `particle` in `pymbe.df`
1178
1179        Args:
1180            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `particle`.  
1181            q (`int`, optional): Charge of the `particle`. Defaults to 0.
1182            diameter (`obj`, optional): Diameter used to setup Lennard-Jones interactions for the `particle`, should have units of length using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
1183            epsilon (`obj`, optional): Epsilon parameter used to setup Lennard-Jones interactions for the `particle`, should have units of energy using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry.. Defaults to None
1184            acidity (`str`, optional): Identifies whether if the particle is `acidic` or `basic`, used to setup constant pH simulations. Defaults to `inert`.
1185            pka (`float`, optional): If `particle` is an acid or a base, it defines its  pka-value. Defaults to None.
1186        """ 
1187        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='particle'):
1188            index = self.df[self.df['name']==name].index[0]                                   
1189        else:
1190            index = len(self.df)
1191            self.df.at [index, 'name'] = name
1192            self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'particle'
1193            
1194        if diameter:
1195            self.add_value_to_df(key=('diameter',''),index=index,new_value=diameter)
1196        if epsilon:
1197            self.add_value_to_df(key=('epsilon',''),index=index,new_value=epsilon)        
1198        
1199        self.set_particle_acidity ( name=name, acidity = acidity , default_charge=q, pka=pka)
1200        return 
1201    
1202    def define_particles_parameter_from_dict(self, param_dict, param_name):
1203        '''
1204        Defines the `param_name` value of the particles in `param_dict` into the `pmb.df`.
1205
1206        Args:
1207            param_dict(`dict`):  {'name': `param_name` value}
1208        '''
1209        for residue in param_dict.keys():
1210            label_list = self.df[self.df['name'] == residue].index.tolist()
1211            for index in label_list:
1212                value = param_dict[residue]
1213                self.add_value_to_df(key= (param_name,''),
1214                        index=int (index),
1215                        new_value=value)
1216        return 
1217    
1218    def define_peptide(self, name, sequence, model):
1219        """
1220        Defines a pyMBE object of type `peptide` in the `pymbe.df`.
1221
1222        Args:
1223            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `peptide`.
1224            sequence (`string`): Sequence of the `peptide`.
1225            model (`string`): Model name. Currently only models with 1 bead '1beadAA' or with 2 beads '2beadAA' per amino acid are supported.
1226        """
1227        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name = name, pmb_type_to_be_defined='peptide'):
1228            valid_keys = ['1beadAA','2beadAA']
1229            if model not in valid_keys:
1230                raise ValueError('Invalid label for the peptide model, please choose between 1beadAA or 2beadAA')
1231        
1232            clean_sequence = self.protein_sequence_parser(sequence=sequence)    
1233            residue_list = self.define_AA_residues(sequence=clean_sequence,model=model)
1234
1235            self.define_molecule(name = name, residue_list=residue_list)
1236            index = self.df.loc[self.df['name'] == name].index.item() 
1237            self.df.at [index,'model'] = model
1238            self.df.at [index,('sequence','')] = clean_sequence
1239        return
1240    
1241    def define_protein(self, name,model, topology_dict):
1242        """
1243        Defines a pyMBE object of type `protein` in `pymbe.df`.
1244
1245        Args:
1246            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `protein`.
1247            model (`string`): Model name. Currently only models with 1 bead '1beadAA' or with 2 beads '2beadAA' per amino acid are supported.
1248            topology_dict (`dict`): {'initial_pos': coords_list, 'chain_id': id, 'diameter': diameter_value}
1249        """
1250
1251        protein_seq_list = []     
1252    
1253        valid_keys = ['1beadAA','2beadAA']
1254
1255        if model not in valid_keys:
1256            raise ValueError('Invalid label for the peptide model, please choose between 1beadAA or 2beadAA')
1257        
1258        if model == '2beadAA':
1259            self.define_particle(name='CA')
1260
1261        for residue in topology_dict.keys():
1262            residue_name = self.re.split(r'\d+', residue)[0]
1263            if residue_name != 'CA' and residue_name != 'Ca':
1264                protein_seq_list.append(residue_name)                  
1265
1266        protein_sequence = ''.join(protein_seq_list)
1267        clean_sequence = self.protein_sequence_parser(sequence=protein_sequence)
1268
1269        self.define_AA_particles_in_sequence (sequence=clean_sequence)
1270        residue_list = self.define_AA_residues(sequence=clean_sequence, model=model)
1271
1272        index = len(self.df)
1273        self.df.at [index,'name'] = name
1274        self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'protein'
1275        self.df.at [index,'model'] = model
1276        self.df.at [index,('sequence','')] = clean_sequence  
1277        self.df.at [index,('residue_list','')] = residue_list    
1278
1279        return 
1280    
1281    def define_residue(self, name, central_bead, side_chains):
1282        """
1283        Defines a pyMBE object of type `residue` in `pymbe.df`.
1284
1285        Args:
1286            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `residue`.
1287            central_bead (`str`): `name` of the `particle` to be placed as central_bead of the `residue`.
1288            side_chains (`list` of `str`): List of `name`s of the pmb_objects to be placed as side_chains of the `residue`. Currently, only pmb_objects of type `particle`s or `residue`s are supported.
1289        """
1290        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='residue'):
1291            return
1292        index = len(self.df)
1293        self.df.at [index, 'name'] = name
1294        self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'residue'
1295        self.df.at [index,'central_bead'] = central_bead
1296        self.df.at [index,('side_chains','')] = side_chains
1297        return 
1298
1299    def destroy_pmb_object_in_system(self, name, espresso_system):
1300        """
1301        Destroys all particles associated with `name` in `espresso_system` amd removes the destroyed pmb_objects from `pmb.df` 
1302
1303        Args:
1304            name (str): Label of the pmb object to be destroyed. The pmb object must be defined in `pymbe.df`.
1305            espresso_system (cls): Instance of a system class from espressomd library.
1306
1307        Note:
1308            - If `name`  is a object_type=`particle`, only the matching particles that are not part of bigger objects (e.g. `residue`, `molecule`) will be destroyed. To destroy particles in such objects, destroy the bigger object instead.
1309        """
1310        allowed_objects = ['particle','residue','molecule']
1311        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
1312        if pmb_type not in allowed_objects:
1313            raise ValueError('Object type not supported, supported types are ', allowed_objects)
1314        if pmb_type == 'particle':
1315            particles_index = self.df.index[(self.df['name'] == name) & (self.df['residue_id'].isna()) 
1316                                                  & (self.df['molecule_id'].isna())]
1317            particle_ids_list= self.df.loc[(self.df['name'] == name) & (self.df['residue_id'].isna())
1318                                                 & (self.df['molecule_id'].isna())].particle_id.tolist()
1319            for particle_id in particle_ids_list:
1320                espresso_system.part.by_id(particle_id).remove()
1321            self.df = self.df.drop(index=particles_index)
1322        if pmb_type == 'residue':
1323            residues_id = self.df.loc[self.df['name']== name].residue_id.to_list()
1324            for residue_id in residues_id:
1325                particle_ids_list = self.df.loc[self.df['residue_id']==residue_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
1326                self.df = self.df.drop(self.df[self.df['residue_id'] == residue_id].index)
1327                for particle_id in particle_ids_list:
1328                    espresso_system.part.by_id(particle_id).remove()
1329                    self.df= self.df.drop(self.df[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id].index)    
1330        if pmb_type == 'molecule':
1331            molecules_id = self.df.loc[self.df['name']== name].molecule_id.to_list()
1332            for molecule_id in molecules_id:
1333                particle_ids_list = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
1334                
1335                self.df = self.df.drop(self.df[self.df['molecule_id'] == molecule_id].index)
1336                for particle_id in particle_ids_list:
1337                    espresso_system.part.by_id(particle_id).remove()   
1338                    self.df= self.df.drop(self.df[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id].index)             
1339        
1340        self.df.reset_index(drop=True,inplace=True)
1341
1342        return
1343
1344    def determine_reservoir_concentrations(self, pH_res, c_salt_res, excess_chemical_potential_monovalent_pair, max_number_sc_runs=200):
1345        """
1346        Determines the concentrations of the various species in the reservoir for given values of the pH and salt concentration.
