  • particle_id1 (int): particle_id of the type of the first particle type of the bonded particles
  • particle_id2 (int): particle_id of the type of the second particle type of the bonded particles
  • use_default_bond (bool, optional): Controls if a bond of type default is used to bond particle whose bond types are not defined in pmb.df. Defaults to False.
def add_bonds_to_espresso(self, espresso_system): 
115    def add_bonds_to_espresso(self, espresso_system) :
116        """
117        Adds all bonds defined in `pmb.df` to `espresso_system`.
118
119        Args:
120            espresso_system (str): system object of espressomd library
121        """
122
123        if 'bond' in self.df.values:
124            bond_df = self.df.loc[self.df ['pmb_type'] == 'bond']
125            bond_list = bond_df.bond_object.values.tolist()
126            for bond in bond_list:
127                espresso_system.bonded_inter.add(bond)
128        else:
129            print ('WARNING: There are no bonds defined in pymbe.df')
130        
131        return

Adds all bonds defined in pmb.df to espresso_system.

Arguments:
  • espresso_system (str): system object of espressomd library
def add_value_to_df(self, index, key, new_value, warning=True): 
133    def add_value_to_df(self,index,key,new_value, warning=True):
134        """
135        Adds a value to a cell in the `pmb.df` DataFrame.
136
137        Args:
138            index(`int`): index of the row to add the value to.
139            key(`str`): the column label to add the value to.
140            warning(`bool`, optional): If true, prints a warning if a value is being overwritten in `pmb.df`. Defaults to true.
141        """
142        # Make sure index is a scalar integer value
143        index = int (index)
144        assert isinstance(index, int), '`index` should be a scalar integer value.'
145        idx = self.pd.IndexSlice
146        if self.check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(index=index,key=key):
147            old_value= self.df.loc[index,idx[key]]
148            if warning:
149                if old_value != new_value:
150                    name=self.df.loc[index,('name','')]
151                    pmb_type=self.df.loc[index,('pmb_type','')]
152                    print(f"WARNING: you are redefining the properties of {name} of pmb_type {pmb_type}")
153                    print(f'WARNING: overwritting the value of the entry `{key}`: old_value = {old_value} new_value = {new_value}')
154        self.df.loc[index,idx[key]] = new_value
155        return

Adds a value to a cell in the pmb.df DataFrame.

Arguments:
  • index(int): index of the row to add the value to.
  • key(str): the column label to add the value to.
  • warning(bool, optional): If true, prints a warning if a value is being overwritten in pmb.df. Defaults to true.
def assign_molecule_id(self, name, molecule_index, pmb_type, used_molecules_id): 
157    def assign_molecule_id(self, name, molecule_index, pmb_type, used_molecules_id):
158        """
159        Assigns the `molecule_id` of the pmb object given by `pmb_type`
160        
161        Args:
162            name(`str`): Label of the molecule type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
163            pmb_type(`str`): pmb_object_type to assign the `molecule_id` 
164            molecule_index (`int`): index of the current `pmb_object_type` to assign the `molecule_id`
165            used_molecules_id (`lst`): list with the `molecule_id` values already used.
166        
167        Returns:
168            molecule_id(`int`): Id of the molecule
169        """
170
171        self.clean_df_row(index=int(molecule_index))
172        
173        if self.df['molecule_id'].isnull().values.all():
174            molecule_id = 0        
175        else:
176            # check if a residue is part of another molecule
177            check_residue_name = self.df[self.df['residue_list'].astype(str).str.contains(name)]
178            pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]                
179            if not check_residue_name.empty and pmb_type == pmb_type :              
180                for value in check_residue_name.index.to_list():                  
181                    if value not in used_molecules_id:                              
182                        molecule_id = self.df.loc[value].molecule_id.values[0]                    
183                        break
184            else:
185                molecule_id = self.df['molecule_id'].max() +1
186
187        self.add_value_to_df (key=('molecule_id',''),
188                                index=int(molecule_index),
189                                new_value=molecule_id, 
190                                warning=False)
191
192        return molecule_id

Assigns the molecule_id of the pmb object given by pmb_type

Arguments:
  • name(str): Label of the molecule type to be created. name must be defined in pmb.df
  • pmb_type(str): pmb_object_type to assign the molecule_id
  • molecule_index (int): index of the current pmb_object_type to assign the molecule_id
  • used_molecules_id (lst): list with the molecule_id values already used.
Returns:

molecule_id(int): Id of the molecule

def calculate_center_of_mass_of_molecule(self, molecule_id, espresso_system): 
194    def calculate_center_of_mass_of_molecule(self, molecule_id, espresso_system):
195        """
196        Calculates the center of mass of type `name`.
197
198        Args:
199            molecule_id(`int`): Id of the molecule to be centered.
200            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
201        
202        Returns:
203            center_of_mass(`lst`): Coordinates of the center of mass.
204        """
205        total_beads = 0
206        center_of_mass = self.np.zeros(3)
207        axis_list = [0,1,2]
208        particle_id_list = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
209        for pid in particle_id_list:
210            total_beads +=1 
211            for axis in axis_list:
212                center_of_mass [axis] += espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).pos[axis]
213        center_of_mass = center_of_mass /total_beads  
214        return center_of_mass

Calculates the center of mass of type name.

Arguments:
  • molecule_id(int): Id of the molecule to be centered.
  • espresso_system(obj): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
Returns:

center_of_mass(lst): Coordinates of the center of mass.

def calculate_HH(self, object_name, pH_list=None, pka_set=None): 
216    def calculate_HH(self, object_name, pH_list=None, pka_set=None):
217        """
218        Calculates the charge per molecule according to the ideal Henderson-Hasselbalch titration curve 
219        for molecules with the name `object_name`.
220
221        Args:
222            object_name (str): name of the molecule to calculate the ideal charge for
223            pH_list(`lst`): pH-values to calculate. 
224            pka_set(`dict`): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}
225
226        Returns:
227            Z_HH (`lst`): Henderson-Hasselbalch prediction of the charge of `sequence` in `pH_list`
228
229        Note:
230            - If no `pH_list` is given, 50 equispaced pH-values ranging from 2 to 12 are calculated
231            - If no `pka_set` is given, the pKa values are taken from `pmb.df`
232            - This function should only be used for single-phase systems. For two-phase systems `calculate_HH_Donnan` has to be used.
233        """
234        if pH_list is None:
235            pH_list=self.np.linspace(2,12,50)    
236        if pka_set is None:
237            pka_set=self.get_pka_set() 
238        self.check_pka_set(pka_set=pka_set)
239        charge_map = self.get_charge_map()
240        Z_HH=[]
241        for pH_value in pH_list:    
242            Z=0
243            index = self.df.loc[self.df['name'] == object_name].index[0].item() 
244            sequence = self.df.at [index,('sequence','')]       
245            if not isinstance(sequence,list):
246                # If the df has been read by file, the sequence needs to be parsed.
247                sequence = sequence.replace(' ', '')
248                sequence = sequence.replace("'", '')
249                sequence=sequence.split(",")[1:-1]
250            for name in sequence:
251                if name in pka_set.keys():
252                    if pka_set[name]['acidity'] == 'acidic':
253                        psi=-1
254                    elif pka_set[name]['acidity']== 'basic':
255                        psi=+1
256                    else:
257                        psi=0
258                    Z+=psi/(1+10**(psi*(pH_value-pka_set[name]['pka_value'])))                      
259                else:
260                    state_one_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.es_type.values[0]
261                    Z+=charge_map[state_one_type]
262            Z_HH.append(Z)
263        return Z_HH

Calculates the charge per molecule according to the ideal Henderson-Hasselbalch titration curve for molecules with the name object_name.

Arguments:
  • object_name (str): name of the molecule to calculate the ideal charge for
  • pH_list(lst): pH-values to calculate.
  • pka_set(dict): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}
Returns:

Z_HH (lst): Henderson-Hasselbalch prediction of the charge of sequence in pH_list

Note:
  • If no pH_list is given, 50 equispaced pH-values ranging from 2 to 12 are calculated
  • If no pka_set is given, the pKa values are taken from pmb.df
  • This function should only be used for single-phase systems. For two-phase systems calculate_HH_Donnan has to be used.
def calculate_HH_Donnan( self, espresso_system, object_names, c_salt, pH_list=None, pka_set=None): 
265    def calculate_HH_Donnan(self, espresso_system, object_names, c_salt, pH_list=None, pka_set=None):
266        """
267        Calculates the charge on the different molecules according to the Henderson-Hasselbalch equation coupled to the Donnan partitioning.
268
269        Args:
270            object_names ('lst'): List of the object names of all (potentially) charged molecules in the system.
271            c_salt ('float'): Salt concentration in the reservoir.
272            pH_list ('lst'): List of pH-values in the reservoir. 
273            pka_set ('dict'): {"name": {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}.
274
275        Returns:
276            {"charges_dict": {"name": charges}, "pH_system_list": pH_system_list, "partition_coefficients": partition_coefficients_list}
277            pH_system_list ('lst'): List of pH_values in the system.
278            partition_coefficients_list ('lst'): List of partition coefficients of cations.
279
280        Note:
281            - If no `pH_list` is given, 50 equispaced pH-values ranging from 2 to 12 are calculated
282            - If no `pka_set` is given, the pKa values are taken from `pmb.df`
283            - If `object_names` does not contain the object names of all (potentially) charged molecules in the system, the calculation will give a wrong result.
284        """
285        if pH_list is None:
286            pH_list=self.np.linspace(2,12,50)    
287        if pka_set is None:
288            pka_set=self.get_pka_set() 
289        self.check_pka_set(pka_set=pka_set)
290
291        partition_coefficients_list = []
292        pH_system_list = []
293        Z_HH_Donnan={}
294        concentrations_molecules={}
295        for key in object_names:
296            Z_HH_Donnan[key] = []
297            # Calculate the concentrations of the different types of molecules
298            concentrations_molecules[key] = (len(self.df.loc[self.df['name'] == key].index) / (self.N_A * self.units.Quantity(espresso_system.volume(), 'reduced_length**3'))).to('mol/liter')
299
300        def calc_charges(object_names, pH):
301            """
302            Calculates the charges of the different kinds of molecules according to the Henderson-Hasselbalch equation.
303
304            Args:
305                object_names ('lst'): List of the object names of all (potentially) charged molecules in the system.
306                pH ('float'): pH-value that is used in the HH equation.
307
308            Returns:
309                charge ('dict'): {"molecule_name": charge}
310            """
311            charge = {}
312            for name in object_names:
313                charge[name] = self.calculate_HH(name, [pH], pka_set)[0]
314            return charge
315
316        def calc_partition_coefficient(charge, concentrations_molecules):
317            """
318            Calculates the partition coefficients of positive ions according to the ideal Donnan theory.
319
320            Args:
321                charge ('dict'): {"molecule_name": charge}
322                concentrations_molecules ('dict'): {"molecule_name": concentration}.
323            """
324            nonlocal ionic_strength_res
325            charge_density = 0.0
326            for key in charge:
327                charge_density += charge[key] * concentrations_molecules[key]
328            return (-charge_density / (2 * ionic_strength_res) + self.np.sqrt((charge_density / (2 * ionic_strength_res))**2 + 1)).magnitude
329
330        for pH_value in pH_list:    
331            # calculate the ionic strength of the reservoir
332            if pH_value <= 7.0:
333                ionic_strength_res = 10 ** (-pH_value) * self.units.mol/self.units.l + c_salt 
334            elif pH_value > 7.0:
335                ionic_strength_res = 10 ** (-(14-pH_value)) * self.units.mol/self.units.l + c_salt
336
337            #Determine the partition coefficient of positive ions by solving the system of nonlinear, coupled equations
338            #consisting of the partition coefficient given by the ideal Donnan theory and the Henderson-Hasselbalch equation.
339            #The nonlinear equation is formulated for log(xi) since log-operations are not supported for RootResult objects.
340            equation = lambda logxi: logxi - self.np.log10(calc_partition_coefficient(calc_charges(object_names, pH_value - logxi), concentrations_molecules))
341            logxi = self.optimize.root_scalar(equation, bracket=[-1e2, 1e2], method="brentq")
342            partition_coefficient = 10**logxi.root
343
344            charges_temp = calc_charges(object_names, pH_value-self.np.log10(partition_coefficient))
345            for key in object_names:
346                Z_HH_Donnan[key].append(charges_temp[key])
347
348            pH_system_list.append(pH_value - self.np.log10(partition_coefficient))
349            partition_coefficients_list.append(partition_coefficient)
350
351        return {"charges_dict": Z_HH_Donnan, "pH_system_list": pH_system_list, "partition_coefficients": partition_coefficients_list}

Calculates the charge on the different molecules according to the Henderson-Hasselbalch equation coupled to the Donnan partitioning.

Arguments:
  • object_names ('lst'): List of the object names of all (potentially) charged molecules in the system.
  • c_salt ('float'): Salt concentration in the reservoir.
  • pH_list ('lst'): List of pH-values in the reservoir.
  • pka_set ('dict'): {"name": {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}.
Returns:

{"charges_dict": {"name": charges}, "pH_system_list": pH_system_list, "partition_coefficients": partition_coefficients_list} pH_system_list ('lst'): List of pH_values in the system. partition_coefficients_list ('lst'): List of partition coefficients of cations.

Note:
  • If no pH_list is given, 50 equispaced pH-values ranging from 2 to 12 are calculated
  • If no pka_set is given, the pKa values are taken from pmb.df
  • If object_names does not contain the object names of all (potentially) charged molecules in the system, the calculation will give a wrong result.
def calculate_initial_bond_length(self, bond_object, bond_type, epsilon, sigma, cutoff): 
353    def calculate_initial_bond_length(self, bond_object, bond_type, epsilon, sigma, cutoff):
354        """
355        Calculates the initial bond length that is used when setting up molecules,
356        based on the minimum of the sum of bonded and short-range (LJ) interactions.
357        
358        Args:
359            bond_object (`cls`): instance of a bond object from espressomd library
360            bond_type (`str`): label identifying the used bonded potential
361            epsilon (`float`): LJ epsilon of the interaction between the particles
362            sigma (`float`): LJ sigma of the interaction between the particles
363            cutoff (`float`): cutoff-radius of the LJ interaction 
364        """    
365        def truncated_lj_potential(x, epsilon, sigma, cutoff):
366            if x>cutoff:
367                return 0.0
368            else:
369                return 4*epsilon*((sigma/x)**12-(sigma/x)**6) - 4*epsilon*((sigma/cutoff)**12-(sigma/cutoff)**6)
370
371        epsilon_red=epsilon.to('reduced_energy').magnitude
372        sigma_red=sigma.to('reduced_length').magnitude
373        cutoff_red=cutoff.to('reduced_length').magnitude
374
375        if bond_type == "harmonic":
376               r_0 = bond_object.params.get('r_0')
377               k = bond_object.params.get('k')
378               l0 = self.optimize.minimize(lambda x: 0.5*k*(x-r_0)**2 + truncated_lj_potential(x, epsilon_red, sigma_red, cutoff_red), x0=r_0).x
379        elif bond_type == "FENE":
380               r_0 = bond_object.params.get('r_0')
381               k = bond_object.params.get('k')
382               d_r_max = bond_object.params.get('d_r_max')
383               l0 = self.optimize.minimize(lambda x: -0.5*k*(d_r_max**2)*self.np.log(1-((x-r_0)/d_r_max)**2) + truncated_lj_potential(x, epsilon_red, sigma_red, cutoff_red), x0=1.0).x
384        return l0

Calculates the initial bond length that is used when setting up molecules, based on the minimum of the sum of bonded and short-range (LJ) interactions.

Arguments:
  • bond_object (cls): instance of a bond object from espressomd library
  • bond_type (str): label identifying the used bonded potential
  • epsilon (float): LJ epsilon of the interaction between the particles
  • sigma (float): LJ sigma of the interaction between the particles
  • cutoff (float): cutoff-radius of the LJ interaction
def calculate_net_charge(self, espresso_system, molecule_name): 
386    def calculate_net_charge (self, espresso_system, molecule_name):
387        '''
388        Calculates the net charge per molecule of molecules with `name` = object_name. 
389        Returns the net charge per molecule and a maps with the net charge per residue and molecule.
390
391        Args:
392            espresso_system: system information 
393            object_name (str): name of the molecule to calculate the net charge
394
395        Returns:
396            {"mean": mean_net_charge, "molecules": {mol_id: net_charge_of_mol_id, }, "residues": {res_id: net_charge_of_res_id, }}
397
398        Note:
399            - The net charge of the molecule is averaged over all molecules of type `name` 
400            - The net charge of each particle type is averaged over all particle of the same type in all molecules of type `name`
401        '''        
402        valid_pmb_types = ["molecule", "protein"]
403        pmb_type=self.df.loc[self.df['name']==molecule_name].pmb_type.values[0]
404        if pmb_type not in valid_pmb_types:
405            raise ValueError("The pyMBE object with name {object_name} has a pmb_type {pmb_type}. This function only supports pyMBE types {valid_pmb_types}")      
406        charge_in_residues = {}
407        id_map = self.get_particle_id_map(object_name=molecule_name)
408        def create_charge_map(espresso_system,id_map,label):
409            charge_map={}
410            for super_id in id_map[label].keys():
411                net_charge=0
412                for pid in id_map[label][super_id]:
413                    net_charge+=espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).q
414                charge_map[super_id]=net_charge
415            return charge_map
416        net_charge_molecules=create_charge_map(label="molecule_map",
417                                                espresso_system=espresso_system,
418                                                id_map=id_map)
419        net_charge_residues=create_charge_map(label="residue_map",
420                                                espresso_system=espresso_system,
421                                                id_map=id_map)       
422        mean_charge=self.np.mean(self.np.array(list(net_charge_molecules.values())))
423        return {"mean": mean_charge, "molecules": net_charge_molecules, "residues": net_charge_residues}

Calculates the net charge per molecule of molecules with name = object_name. Returns the net charge per molecule and a maps with the net charge per residue and molecule.

Arguments:
  • espresso_system: system information
  • object_name (str): name of the molecule to calculate the net charge
Returns:

{"mean": mean_net_charge, "molecules": {mol_id: net_charge_of_mol_id, }, "residues": {res_id: net_charge_of_res_id, }}

Note:
  • The net charge of the molecule is averaged over all molecules of type name
  • The net charge of each particle type is averaged over all particle of the same type in all molecules of type name
def center_molecule_in_simulation_box(self, molecule_id, espresso_system): 
425    def center_molecule_in_simulation_box(self, molecule_id, espresso_system):
426        """
427        Centers the pmb object matching `molecule_id` in the center of the simulation box in `espresso_md`.
428        
429        Args:
430            molecule_id(`int`): Id of the molecule to be centered.
431            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
432        """
433        center_of_mass = self.calculate_center_of_mass_of_molecule ( molecule_id=molecule_id,espresso_system=espresso_system)
434        box_center = [espresso_system.box_l[0]/2.0]*3
435        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].pmb_type.values[0]
436        pmb_objects = ['protein','molecule','peptide']
437        if pmb_type in pmb_objects:
438            particle_id_list = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
439            for pid in particle_id_list:
440                es_pos = espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).pos
441                espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).pos = es_pos - center_of_mass + box_center
442        return

Centers the pmb object matching molecule_id in the center of the simulation box in espresso_md.

Arguments:
  • molecule_id(int): Id of the molecule to be centered.
  • espresso_system(obj): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
def check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(self, index, key): 
444    def check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(self, index,key):
445        """
446        Checks if a cell in the `pmb.df` at the specified index and column has a value.
447
448        Args:
449            index(`int`): Index of the row to check.
450            key(`str`): Column label to check.
451
452        Returns:
453            `bool`: `True` if the cell has a value, `False` otherwise.
454        """
455        idx = self.pd.IndexSlice
456        return not self.pd.isna(self.df.loc[index, idx[key]])

Checks if a cell in the pmb.df at the specified index and column has a value.

Arguments:
  • index(int): Index of the row to check.
  • key(str): Column label to check.
Returns:

bool: True if the cell has a value, False otherwise.

def check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(self, name, pmb_type_to_be_defined): 
458    def check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(self, name, pmb_type_to_be_defined):
459        """
460        Checks if `name` is defined in `pmb.df`.
461
462        Args:
463            name(`str`): label to check if defined in `pmb.df`.
464            pmb_type_to_be_defined(`str`): pmb object type corresponding to `name`.
465
466        Returns:
467            `bool`: `True` for success, `False` otherwise.
468        """
469        if name in self.df['name'].unique():
470            current_object_type = self.df[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
471            if  current_object_type != pmb_type_to_be_defined:
472                raise ValueError ((f"The name {name} is already defined in the df with a pmb_type = {current_object_type}, pymMBE does not support objects with the same name but different pmb_types"))    
473            return True            
474        else:
475            return False

Checks if name is defined in pmb.df.

Arguments:
  • name(str): label to check if defined in pmb.df.
  • pmb_type_to_be_defined(str): pmb object type corresponding to name.
Returns:

bool: True for success, False otherwise.

def check_pka_set(self, pka_set): 
477    def check_pka_set(self, pka_set):
478        """
479        Checks that `pka_set` has the formatting expected by the pyMBE library.
480       
481        Args:
482            pka_set (dict): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}
483        """
484        required_keys=['pka_value','acidity']
485        for required_key in required_keys:
486            for pka_entry in pka_set.values():
487                if required_key not in pka_entry.keys():
488                    raise ValueError('missing a requiered key ', required_keys, 'in the following entry of pka_set', pka_entry)
489        return

Checks that pka_set has the formatting expected by the pyMBE library.

Arguments:
  • pka_set (dict): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}
def clean_df_row( self, index, columns_keys_to_clean=['particle_id', 'particle_id2', 'residue_id', 'molecule_id']): 
491    def clean_df_row(self, index, columns_keys_to_clean=["particle_id", "particle_id2", "residue_id", "molecule_id"]):
492        """
493        Cleans the columns of `pmb.df` in `columns_keys_to_clean` of the row with index `index` by assigning them a np.nan value.
494
495        Args:
496            index(`int`): Index of the row to clean.
497            columns_keys_to_clean(`list` of `str`, optional): List with the column keys to be cleaned. Defaults to [`particle_id`, `particle_id2`, `residue_id`, `molecule_id`].
498        """   
499        for column_key in columns_keys_to_clean:
500            self.add_value_to_df(key=(column_key,''),index=index,new_value=self.np.nan, warning=False)
501        return

Cleans the columns of pmb.df in columns_keys_to_clean of the row with index index by assigning them a np.nan value.

Arguments:
  • index(int): Index of the row to clean.
  • columns_keys_to_clean(list of str, optional): List with the column keys to be cleaned. Defaults to [particle_id, particle_id2, residue_id, molecule_id].
def copy_df_entry(self, name, column_name, number_of_copies): 
503    def copy_df_entry(self, name, column_name, number_of_copies):
504        '''
505        Creates 'number_of_copies' of a given 'name' in `pymbe.df`.
506
507        Args:
508            name(`str`): Label of the particle/residue/molecule type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
509            column_name(`str`): Column name to use as a filter. 
510            number_of_copies(`int`): number of copies of `name` to be created.
511        
512        Note:
513            - Currently, column_name only supports "particle_id", "particle_id2", "residue_id" and "molecule_id" 
514        '''
515
516        valid_column_names=["particle_id", "residue_id", "molecule_id", "particle_id2" ]
517        if column_name not in valid_column_names:
518            raise ValueError(f"{column_name} is not a valid column_name, currently only the following are supported: {valid_column_names}")
519        df_by_name = self.df.loc[self.df.name == name]
520        if number_of_copies != 1:           
521            if df_by_name[column_name].isnull().values.any():       
522                    df_by_name_repeated = self.pd.concat ([df_by_name]*(number_of_copies-1), ignore_index=True)
523            else:
524                df_by_name = df_by_name[df_by_name.index == df_by_name.index.min()] 
525                df_by_name_repeated = self.pd.concat ([df_by_name]*(number_of_copies), ignore_index=True)
526                df_by_name_repeated[column_name] =self.np.NaN
527            # Concatenate the new particle rows to  `df`
528            self.df = self.pd.concat ([self.df,df_by_name_repeated], ignore_index=True)
529        else:
530            if not df_by_name[column_name].isnull().values.any():     
531                df_by_name = df_by_name[df_by_name.index == df_by_name.index.min()] 
532                df_by_name_repeated = self.pd.concat ([df_by_name]*(number_of_copies), ignore_index=True)
533                df_by_name_repeated[column_name] =self.np.NaN
534                self.df = self.pd.concat ([self.df,df_by_name_repeated], ignore_index=True)        
535        return

Creates 'number_of_copies' of a given 'name' in pymbe.df.

Arguments:
  • name(str): Label of the particle/residue/molecule type to be created. name must be defined in pmb.df
  • column_name(str): Column name to use as a filter.
  • number_of_copies(int): number of copies of name to be created.
Note:
  • Currently, column_name only supports "particle_id", "particle_id2", "residue_id" and "molecule_id"
def create_added_salt(self, espresso_system, cation_name, anion_name, c_salt): 
537    def create_added_salt (self, espresso_system, cation_name, anion_name, c_salt):    
538        """
539        Creates a `c_salt` concentration of `cation_name` and `anion_name` ions into the `espresso_system`.
540
541        Args:
542            espresso_system (`obj`): instance of an espresso system object.
543            cation_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a positive charge.
544            anion_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a negative charge.
545            c_salt (float): Salt concentration. 
546            
547        Returns:
548            c_salt_calculated (float): Calculated salt concentration added to `espresso_system`.
549        """
550        cation_name_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==cation_name].state_one.charge.values[0]
551        anion_name_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==anion_name].state_one.charge.values[0]     
552        if cation_name_charge <= 0:
553            raise ValueError('ERROR cation charge must be positive, charge ',cation_name_charge)
554        if anion_name_charge >= 0:
555            raise ValueError('ERROR anion charge must be negative, charge ', anion_name_charge)
556        # Calculate the number of ions in the simulation box
557        volume=self.units.Quantity(espresso_system.volume(), 'reduced_length**3')
558        if c_salt.check('[substance] [length]**-3'):
559            N_ions= int((volume*c_salt.to('mol/reduced_length**3')*self.N_A).magnitude)
560            c_salt_calculated=N_ions/(volume*self.N_A)
561        elif c_salt.check('[length]**-3'):
562            N_ions= int((volume*c_salt.to('reduced_length**-3')*self.N_A).magnitude)
563            c_salt_calculated=N_ions/volume
564        else:
565            raise ValueError('Unknown units for c_salt, please provided it in [mol / volume] or [particle / volume]', c_salt)
566        N_cation = N_ions*abs(anion_name_charge)
567        N_anion = N_ions*abs(cation_name_charge)
568        self.create_particle(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=cation_name, number_of_particles=N_cation)
569        self.create_particle(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=anion_name, number_of_particles=N_anion)
570        print('\n Added salt concentration of ', c_salt_calculated.to('mol/L'), 'given by ', N_cation, ' cations and ', N_anion, ' anions')
571        return c_salt_calculated

Creates a c_salt concentration of cation_name and anion_name ions into the espresso_system.

Arguments:
  • espresso_system (obj): instance of an espresso system object.
  • cation_name(str): name of a particle with a positive charge.
  • anion_name(str): name of a particle with a negative charge.
  • c_salt (float): Salt concentration.
Returns:

c_salt_calculated (float): Calculated salt concentration added to espresso_system.

def create_counterions(self, object_name, cation_name, anion_name, espresso_system): 
573    def create_counterions(self, object_name, cation_name, anion_name, espresso_system):
574        """
575        Creates particles of `cation_name` and `anion_name` in `espresso_system` to counter the net charge of `pmb_object`.
576        
577        Args:
578            object_name(`str`): `name` of a pymbe object.
579            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
580            cation_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a positive charge.
581            anion_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a negative charge.
582
583        Returns: 
584            counterion_number (dict): {"name": number}
585        """
586        cation_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==cation_name].state_one.charge.iloc[0]
587        anion_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==anion_name].state_one.charge.iloc[0]
588        object_ids = self.get_particle_id_map(object_name=object_name)["all"]
589        counterion_number={}
590        object_charge={}
591        for name in ['positive', 'negative']:
592            object_charge[name]=0
593        for id in object_ids:
594            if espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q > 0:
595                object_charge['positive']+=1*(self.np.abs(espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q ))
596            elif espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q < 0:
597                object_charge['negative']+=1*(self.np.abs(espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q ))
598        if (object_charge['positive'] % abs(anion_charge) == 0):
599            counterion_number[anion_name]=int(object_charge['positive']/abs(anion_charge))
600        else:
601            raise ValueError('The number of positive charges in the pmb_object must be divisible by the  charge of the anion')
602        if (object_charge['negative'] % abs(cation_charge) == 0):
603            counterion_number[cation_name]=int(object_charge['negative']/cation_charge)
604        else:
605            raise ValueError('The number of negative charges in the pmb_object must be divisible by the  charge of the cation')
606        if counterion_number[cation_name] > 0: 
607            self.create_particle(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=cation_name, number_of_particles=counterion_number[cation_name])
608        else:
609            counterion_number[cation_name]=0
610        if counterion_number[anion_name] > 0:
611            self.create_particle(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=anion_name, number_of_particles=counterion_number[anion_name])
612        else:
613            counterion_number[anion_name] = 0
614        print('The following counter-ions have been created: ')
615        for name in counterion_number.keys():
616            print(f'Ion type: {name} created number: {counterion_number[name]}')
617        return counterion_number

Creates particles of cation_name and anion_name in espresso_system to counter the net charge of pmb_object.

Arguments:
  • object_name(str): name of a pymbe object.
  • espresso_system(obj): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
  • cation_name(str): name of a particle with a positive charge.
  • anion_name(str): name of a particle with a negative charge.

Returns: counterion_number (dict): {"name": number}

def create_molecule( self, name, number_of_molecules, espresso_system, first_residue_position=None, use_default_bond=False): 
619    def create_molecule(self, name, number_of_molecules, espresso_system, first_residue_position=None, use_default_bond=False):
620        """
621        Creates `number_of_molecules` molecule of type `name` into `espresso_system` and bookkeeps them into `pmb.df`.
622
623        Args:
624            name(`str`): Label of the molecule type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
625            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from espressomd library.
626            number_of_molecules(`int`): Number of molecules of type `name` to be created.
627            first_residue_position(`list`, optional): coordinates where the first_residue_position will be created, random by default
628            use_default_bond(`bool`, optional): Controls if a bond of type `default` is used to bond particle with undefined bonds in `pymbe.df`
629        Returns:
630            molecules_info (`dict`):  {molecule_id: {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids": [particle_id1, ...]}}} 
631        """
632        if number_of_molecules <= 0:
633            return
634        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,
635                                                    pmb_type_to_be_defined='molecule'):
636            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a label of a pmb_type='molecule' defined on df")
637        first_residue = True
638        molecule_info = []
639        residue_list = self.df[self.df['name']==name].residue_list.values [0]
640
641        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,
642                        column_name='molecule_id',
643                        number_of_copies=number_of_molecules)
644        
645        molecules_index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
646        molecule_index_list =list(molecules_index[0])[-number_of_molecules:]
647        used_molecules_id = self.df.molecule_id.dropna().drop_duplicates().tolist()
648
649        for molecule_index in molecule_index_list:         
650
651            molecule_id = self.assign_molecule_id (name=name,pmb_type='molecule',used_molecules_id=used_molecules_id,molecule_index=molecule_index)
652
653            for residue in residue_list:
654                if first_residue:
655                    residue_position = first_residue_position
656                    backbone_vector = self.generate_trialvectors(center=[0,0,0], 
657                                                                 radius=1, 
658                                                                 n_samples=1,
659                                                                 on_surface=True)[0]
660                    residues_info = self.create_residue(name=residue,
661                                                                    number_of_residues=1, 
662                                                                    espresso_system=espresso_system, 
663                                                                    central_bead_position=first_residue_position,  
664                                                                    use_default_bond= use_default_bond, 
665                                                                    backbone_vector=backbone_vector)
666                    residue_id = next(iter(residues_info))
667                    for index in self.df[self.df['residue_id']==residue_id].index:
668                        self.add_value_to_df(key=('molecule_id',''),
669                                            index=int (index),
670                                            new_value=molecule_id)
671                    central_bead_id = residues_info[residue_id]['central_bead_id']
672                    previous_residue = residue
673                    residue_position = espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).pos
674                    previous_residue_id = central_bead_id
675                    first_residue = False          
676                else:                    
677                    previous_central_bead_name=self.df[self.df['name']==previous_residue].central_bead.values[0]
678                    new_central_bead_name=self.df[self.df['name']==residue].central_bead.values[0]       
679                    bond = self.search_bond(particle_name1=previous_central_bead_name, 
680                                            particle_name2=new_central_bead_name, 
681                                            hard_check=True, 
682                                            use_default_bond=use_default_bond)                
683                    l0 = self.get_bond_length(particle_name1=previous_central_bead_name, 
684                                              particle_name2=new_central_bead_name, 
685                                              hard_check=True, 
686                                              use_default_bond=use_default_bond)                
687                    residue_position = residue_position+backbone_vector*l0
688                    residues_info = self.create_residue(name=residue, 
689                                                                    number_of_residues=1, 
690                                                                    espresso_system=espresso_system, 
691                                                                    central_bead_position=[residue_position],
692                                                                    use_default_bond= use_default_bond)
693                    residue_id = next(iter(residues_info))      
694                    for index in self.df[self.df['residue_id']==residue_id].index:
695                        if not self.check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(index=index,key=('molecule_id','')):
696                            self.df.at[index,'molecule_id'] = molecule_id
697                            self.add_value_to_df(key=('molecule_id',''),
698                                                index=int (index),
699                                                new_value=molecule_id,
700                                                warning=False)            
701                    central_bead_id = residues_info[residue_id]['central_bead_id']
702                    espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).add_bond((bond, previous_residue_id))
703                    self.add_bond_in_df(particle_id1=central_bead_id,
704                                        particle_id2=previous_residue_id,
705                                        use_default_bond=use_default_bond)            
706                    previous_residue_id = central_bead_id
707                    previous_residue = residue                    
708                molecule_info.append(residues_info)
709            first_residue = True
710        return molecule_info

Creates number_of_molecules molecule of type name into espresso_system and bookkeeps them into pmb.df.

Arguments:
  • name(str): Label of the molecule type to be created. name must be defined in pmb.df
  • espresso_system(obj): Instance of a system object from espressomd library.
  • number_of_molecules(int): Number of molecules of type name to be created.
  • first_residue_position(list, optional): coordinates where the first_residue_position will be created, random by default
  • use_default_bond(bool, optional): Controls if a bond of type default is used to bond particle with undefined bonds in pymbe.df
Returns:

molecules_info (dict): {molecule_id: {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids": [particle_id1, ...]}}}

def create_particle( self, name, espresso_system, number_of_particles, position=None, fix=False): 
712    def create_particle(self, name, espresso_system, number_of_particles, position=None, fix=False):
713        """
714        Creates `number_of_particles` particles of type `name` into `espresso_system` and bookkeeps them into `pymbe.df`.
715        
716        Args:
717            name (`str`): Label of the particle type to be created. `name` must be a `particle` defined in `pmb_df`. 
718            espresso_system (`cls`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
719            number_of_particles (`int`): Number of particles to be created.
720            position (list of [`float`,`float`,`float`], optional): Initial positions of the particles. If not given, particles are created in random positions. Defaults to None.
721            fix(`bool`, optional): Controls if the particle motion is frozen in the integrator, it is used to create rigid objects. Defaults to False.
722        Returns:
723            created_pid_list(`list` of `float`): List with the ids of the particles created into `espresso_system`.
724        """       
725        if number_of_particles <=0:
726            return
727        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='particle'):
728            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a label of a pmb_type='particle' defined on df")
729        # Copy the data of the particle `number_of_particles` times in the `df`
730        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,column_name='particle_id',number_of_copies=number_of_particles)
731        # Get information from the particle type `name` from the df     
732        q = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.charge.values[0]
733        es_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.es_type.values[0]
734        # Get a list of the index in `df` corresponding to the new particles to be created
735        index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
736        index_list =list(index[0])[-number_of_particles:]
737        # Create the new particles into  `espresso_system`
738        created_pid_list=[]
739        for index in range (number_of_particles):
740            df_index=int (index_list[index])
741            self.clean_df_row(index=df_index)
742            if position is None:
743                particle_position = self.np.random.random((1, 3))[0] *self.np.copy(espresso_system.box_l)
744            else:
745                particle_position = position[index]
746            if len(espresso_system.part.all()) == 0:
747                bead_id = 0
748            else:
749                bead_id = max (espresso_system.part.all().id) + 1
750            created_pid_list.append(bead_id)
751            
752            if fix:
753                espresso_system.part.add (id=bead_id, pos = particle_position, type = es_type, q = q,fix =[fix,fix,fix])        
754            else:
755                espresso_system.part.add (id=bead_id, pos = particle_position, type = es_type, q = q)        
756            self.add_value_to_df(key=('particle_id',''),index=df_index,new_value=bead_id, warning=False)                  
757        return created_pid_list

Creates number_of_particles particles of type name into espresso_system and bookkeeps them into pymbe.df.

Arguments:
  • name (str): Label of the particle type to be created. name must be a particle defined in pmb_df.
  • espresso_system (cls): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
  • number_of_particles (int): Number of particles to be created.
  • position (list of [float,float,float], optional): Initial positions of the particles. If not given, particles are created in random positions. Defaults to None.
  • fix(bool, optional): Controls if the particle motion is frozen in the integrator, it is used to create rigid objects. Defaults to False.
Returns:

created_pid_list(list of float): List with the ids of the particles created into espresso_system.

def create_pmb_object( self, name, number_of_objects, espresso_system, position=None, use_default_bond=False): 
759    def create_pmb_object (self, name, number_of_objects, espresso_system, position=None, use_default_bond=False):
760        """
761        Creates all `particle`s associated to `pmb object` into  `espresso` a number of times equal to `number_of_objects`.
762        
763        Args:
764            name(`str`): Unique label of the `pmb object` to be created. 
765            number_of_objects(`int`): Number of `pmb object`s to be created.
766            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of an espresso system object from espressomd library.
767            position(`list`): Coordinates where the particles should be created.
768            use_default_bond(`bool`,optional): Controls if a `default` bond is used to bond particles with undefined bonds in `pmb.df`. Defaults to `False`.
769
770        Note:
771            - If no `position` is given, particles will be created in random positions. For bonded particles, they will be created at a distance equal to the bond length. 
772        """
773        allowed_objects=['particle','residue','molecule']
774        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
775        if pmb_type not in allowed_objects:
776            raise ValueError('Object type not supported, supported types are ', allowed_objects)
777        if pmb_type == 'particle':
778            self.create_particle(name=name, number_of_particles=number_of_objects, espresso_system=espresso_system, position=position)
779        elif pmb_type == 'residue':
780            self.create_residue(name=name,number_of_residues=number_of_objects, espresso_system=espresso_system, central_bead_position=position,use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
781        elif pmb_type == 'molecule':
782            self.create_molecule(name=name,number_of_molecules=number_of_objects, espresso_system=espresso_system, use_default_bond=use_default_bond, first_residue_position=position)
783        return

Creates all particles associated to pmb object into espresso a number of times equal to number_of_objects.

Arguments:
  • name(str): Unique label of the pmb object to be created.
  • number_of_objects(int): Number of pmb objects to be created.
  • espresso_system(obj): Instance of an espresso system object from espressomd library.
  • position(list): Coordinates where the particles should be created.
  • use_default_bond(bool,optional): Controls if a default bond is used to bond particles with undefined bonds in pmb.df. Defaults to False.
Note:
  • If no position is given, particles will be created in random positions. For bonded particles, they will be created at a distance equal to the bond length.
def create_protein(self, name, number_of_proteins, espresso_system, topology_dict): 
785    def create_protein(self, name, number_of_proteins, espresso_system, topology_dict):
786        """
787        Creates `number_of_proteins` molecules of type `name` into `espresso_system` at the coordinates in `positions`
788
789        Args:
790            name(`str`): Label of the protein to be created. 
791            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
792            number_of_proteins(`int`): Number of proteins to be created.
793            positions(`dict`): {'ResidueNumber': {'initial_pos': [], 'chain_id': ''}}
794        """
795
796        if number_of_proteins <=0:
797            return
798        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,
799                                                  pmb_type_to_be_defined='protein'):
800            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a name of a pmb_type='protein' defined on df")
801
802        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,column_name='molecule_id',number_of_copies=number_of_proteins)
803
804        protein_index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
805        protein_index_list =list(protein_index[0])[-number_of_proteins:]
806        used_molecules_id = self.df.molecule_id.dropna().drop_duplicates().tolist()
807        
808        box_half=espresso_system.box_l[0]/2.0
809
810        for molecule_index in protein_index_list:     
811
812            molecule_id = self.assign_molecule_id (name=name,pmb_type='protein',used_molecules_id=used_molecules_id,molecule_index=molecule_index)
813
814            protein_center = self.generate_coordinates_outside_sphere(radius = 1, 
815                                                                        max_dist=box_half, 
816                                                                        n_samples=1, 
817                                                                        center=[box_half]*3)[0]
818   
819            for residue in topology_dict.keys():
820
821                residue_name = self.re.split(r'\d+', residue)[0]
822                residue_number = self.re.split(r'(\d+)', residue)[1]
823                residue_position = topology_dict[residue]['initial_pos']
824                position = residue_position + protein_center
825
826                particle_id = self.create_particle(name=residue_name,
827                                                            espresso_system=espresso_system,
828                                                            number_of_particles=1,
829                                                            position=[position], 
830                                                            fix = True)
831
832                index = self.df[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id[0]].index.values[0]
833
834                self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
835                                            index=int (index),
836                                            new_value=residue_number)
837
838                self.add_value_to_df(key=('molecule_id',''),
839                                        index=int (index),
840                                        new_value=molecule_id)
841
842        return

Creates number_of_proteins molecules of type name into espresso_system at the coordinates in positions

Arguments:
  • name(str): Label of the protein to be created.
  • espresso_system(obj): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
  • number_of_proteins(int): Number of proteins to be created.
  • positions(dict): {'ResidueNumber': {'initial_pos': [], 'chain_id': ''}}
def create_residue( self, name, espresso_system, number_of_residues, central_bead_position=None, use_default_bond=False, backbone_vector=None): 
844    def create_residue(self, name, espresso_system, number_of_residues, central_bead_position=None,use_default_bond=False, backbone_vector=None):
845        """
846        Creates `number_of_residues` residues of type `name` into `espresso_system` and bookkeeps them into `pmb.df`.
847
848        Args:
849            name(`str`): Label of the residue type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
850            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from espressomd library.
851            number_of_residue(`int`): Number of residues of type `name` to be created.
852            central_bead_position(`list` of `float`): Position of the central bead.
853            use_default_bond (`bool`): Switch to control if a bond of type `default` is used to bond a particle whose bonds types are not defined in `pmb.df`
854            backbone_vector (`list` of `float`): Backbone vector of the molecule. All side chains are created perpendicularly to `backbone_vector`.
855
856        Returns:
857            residues_info (`dict`): {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids":[particle_id1, ...]}}
858        """
859        if number_of_residues <= 0:
860            return
861        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,
862                                                    pmb_type_to_be_defined='residue'):
863            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a label of a pmb_type='residue' defined on df")
864        # Copy the data of a residue a `number_of_residues` times in the `df
865        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,
866                            column_name='residue_id',
867                            number_of_copies=number_of_residues)
868        residues_index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
869        residue_index_list =list(residues_index[0])[-number_of_residues:]
870        # Internal bookkepping of the residue info (important for side-chain residues)
871        # Dict structure {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids":[particle_id1, ...]}}
872        residues_info={}
873        for residue_index in residue_index_list:     
874            self.clean_df_row(index=int(residue_index))
875            # Assign a residue_id
876            if self.df['residue_id'].isnull().all():
877                residue_id=0
878            else:
879                residue_id = self.df['residue_id'].max() + 1
880            self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),index=int (residue_index),new_value=residue_id, warning=False)
881            # create the principal bead
882            if self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].central_bead.values[0] is self.np.NaN:
883                raise ValueError("central_bead must contain a particle name")        
884            central_bead_name = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].central_bead.values[0]            
885            central_bead_id = self.create_particle(name=central_bead_name,
886                                                                espresso_system=espresso_system,
887                                                                position=central_bead_position,
888                                                                number_of_particles = 1)[0]
889            central_bead_position=espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).pos
890            #assigns same residue_id to the central_bead particle created.
891            index = self.df[self.df['particle_id']==central_bead_id].index.values[0]
892            self.df.at [index,'residue_id'] = residue_id
893            # Internal bookkeeping of the central bead id
894            residues_info[residue_id]={}
895            residues_info[residue_id]['central_bead_id']=central_bead_id
896            # create the lateral beads  
897            side_chain_list = self.df.loc[self.df.index[residue_index]].side_chains.values[0]
898            side_chain_beads_ids = []
899            for side_chain_element in side_chain_list:
900                if side_chain_element not in self.df.values:              
901                        raise ValueError (side_chain_element +'is not defined')
902                pmb_type = self.df[self.df['name']==side_chain_element].pmb_type.values[0] 
903                if pmb_type == 'particle':
904                    bond = self.search_bond(particle_name1=central_bead_name, 
905                                            particle_name2=side_chain_element, 
906                                            hard_check=True, 
907                                            use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
908                    l0 = self.get_bond_length(particle_name1=central_bead_name, 
909                                              particle_name2=side_chain_element, 
910                                              hard_check=True, 
911                                              use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
912                    if backbone_vector is None:
913                        bead_position=self.generate_trialvectors(center=central_bead_position, 
914                                                                 radius=l0, 
915                                                                 n_samples=1,
916                                                                 on_surface=True)[0]
917                    else:
918                        bead_position=self.generate_trial_perpendicular_vector(vector=backbone_vector,
919                                                                            center=central_bead_position, 
920                                                                            radius=l0)
921                        
922                    side_bead_id = self.create_particle(name=side_chain_element, 
923                                                                    espresso_system=espresso_system,
924                                                                    position=[bead_position], 
925                                                                    number_of_particles=1)[0]
926                    index = self.df[self.df['particle_id']==side_bead_id].index.values[0]
927                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
928                                        index=int (index),
929                                        new_value=residue_id, 
930                                        warning=False)
931                    side_chain_beads_ids.append(side_bead_id)
932                    espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).add_bond((bond, side_bead_id))
933                    self.add_bond_in_df(particle_id1=central_bead_id,
934                                        particle_id2=side_bead_id,
935                                        use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
936                elif pmb_type == 'residue':
937                    central_bead_side_chain = self.df[self.df['name']==side_chain_element].central_bead.values[0]
938                    bond = self.search_bond(particle_name1=central_bead_name, 
939                                            particle_name2=central_bead_side_chain, 
940                                            hard_check=True, 
941                                            use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
942                    l0 = self.get_bond_length(particle_name1=central_bead_name, 
943                                              particle_name2=central_bead_side_chain, 
944                                              hard_check=True, 
945                                              use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
946                    if backbone_vector is None:
947                        residue_position=self.generate_trialvectors(center=central_bead_position, 
948                                                                    radius=l0, 
949                                                                    n_samples=1,
950                                                                    on_surface=True)[0]
951                    else:
952                        residue_position=self.generate_trial_perpendicular_vector(vector=backbone_vector,
953                                                                                center=central_bead_position, 
954                                                                                radius=l0)
955                    lateral_residue_info = self.create_residue(name=side_chain_element, espresso_system=espresso_system,
956                        number_of_residues=1, central_bead_position=[residue_position],use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
957                    lateral_residue_dict=list(lateral_residue_info.values())[0]
958                    central_bead_side_chain_id=lateral_residue_dict['central_bead_id']
959                    lateral_beads_side_chain_ids=lateral_residue_dict['side_chain_ids']
960                    residue_id_side_chain=list(lateral_residue_info.keys())[0]
961                    # Change the residue_id of the residue in the side chain to the one of the biger residue
962                    index = self.df[(self.df['residue_id']==residue_id_side_chain) & (self.df['pmb_type']=='residue') ].index.values[0]
963                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
964                                        index=int(index),
965                                        new_value=residue_id, 
966                                        warning=False)
967                    # Change the residue_id of the particles in the residue in the side chain
968                    side_chain_beads_ids+=[central_bead_side_chain_id]+lateral_beads_side_chain_ids
969                    for particle_id in side_chain_beads_ids:
970                        index = self.df[(self.df['particle_id']==particle_id) & (self.df['pmb_type']=='particle')].index.values[0]
971                        self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
972                                            index=int (index),
973                                            new_value=residue_id, 
974                                            warning=False)
975                    espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).add_bond((bond, central_bead_side_chain_id))
976                    self.add_bond_in_df(particle_id1=central_bead_id,
977                                        particle_id2=central_bead_side_chain_id,
978                                        use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
979            # Internal bookkeeping of the side chain beads ids
980            residues_info[residue_id]['side_chain_ids']=side_chain_beads_ids
981        return  residues_info

Creates number_of_residues residues of type name into espresso_system and bookkeeps them into pmb.df.

Arguments:
  • name(str): Label of the residue type to be created. name must be defined in pmb.df
  • espresso_system(obj): Instance of a system object from espressomd library.
  • number_of_residue(int): Number of residues of type name to be created.
  • central_bead_position(list of float): Position of the central bead.
  • use_default_bond (bool): Switch to control if a bond of type default is used to bond a particle whose bonds types are not defined in pmb.df
  • backbone_vector (list of float): Backbone vector of the molecule. All side chains are created perpendicularly to backbone_vector.
Returns:

residues_info (dict): {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids":[particle_id1, ...]}}

def create_variable_with_units(self, variable_dict): 
983    def create_variable_with_units(self, variable_dict):
984        """
985        Returns a pint object with the value and units defined in `variable_dict`.
986
987        Args:
988            variable_dict(`dict`): {'value': value, 'units': units}
989        Returns:
990            variable_with_units(`obj`): variable with units using the pyMBE UnitRegistry.
991        """        
992        value=variable_dict.pop('value')
993        units=variable_dict.pop('units')
994        variable_with_units=value*self.units(units)
995
996        return variable_with_units

Returns a pint object with the value and units defined in variable_dict.

Arguments:
  • variable_dict(dict): {'value': value, 'units': units}
Returns:

variable_with_units(obj): variable with units using the pyMBE UnitRegistry.

def define_AA_particles_in_sequence(self, sequence): 
 998    def define_AA_particles_in_sequence(self, sequence):
 999        '''
1000        Defines in `pmb.df` all the different particles in `sequence`.
1001
1002        Args:
1003            sequence(`lst`):  Sequence of the peptide or protein. 
1004
1005        Note:
1006            - It assumes that the names in `sequence` correspond to amino acid names using the standard one letter code.
1007        '''
1008
1009        already_defined_AA=[]
1010        acidic_aminoacids = ['c','E','D','Y','C']
1011        basic_aminoacids  = ['R','n','K','H']
1012
1013        for residue_name in sequence:
1014            if residue_name in already_defined_AA:
1015                continue
1016            if residue_name in acidic_aminoacids:
1017                self.define_particle (name=residue_name, acidity='acidic')
1018            elif residue_name in basic_aminoacids:
1019                self.define_particle (name=residue_name, acidity='basic')
1020            else:
1021                self.define_particle (name=residue_name, q=0)
1022        return

Defines in pmb.df all the different particles in sequence.

Arguments:
  • sequence(lst): Sequence of the peptide or protein.
Note:
  • It assumes that the names in sequence correspond to amino acid names using the standard one letter code.
def define_AA_residues(self, sequence, model): 
1024    def define_AA_residues(self, sequence, model):
1025        """
1026        Defines in `pmb.df` all the different residues in `sequence`.
1027
1028        Args:
1029            sequence(`lst`):  Sequence of the peptide or protein.
1030            model (`string`): Model name. Currently only models with 1 bead '1beadAA' or with 2 beads '2beadAA' per amino acid are supported.
1031
1032        Returns:
1033            residue_list (`list` of `str`): List of the `name`s of the `residue`s  in the sequence of the `molecule`.             
1034        """
1035        residue_list = []
1036        for residue_name in sequence:
1037            if model == '1beadAA':
1038                central_bead = residue_name
1039                side_chains = []
1040            elif model == '2beadAA':
1041                if residue_name in ['c','n', 'G']: 
1042                    central_bead = residue_name
1043                    side_chains = []
1044                else:
1045                    central_bead = 'CA'              
1046                    side_chains = [residue_name]
1047            if residue_name not in residue_list:   
1048                self.define_residue(name = 'AA-'+residue_name, 
1049                                    central_bead = central_bead,
1050                                    side_chains = side_chains)              
1051            residue_list.append('AA-'+residue_name)
1052        return residue_list

Defines in pmb.df all the different residues in sequence.

Arguments:
  • sequence(lst): Sequence of the peptide or protein.
  • model (string): Model name. Currently only models with 1 bead '1beadAA' or with 2 beads '2beadAA' per amino acid are supported.
Returns:

residue_list (list of str): List of the names of the residues in the sequence of the molecule.

def define_bond(self, bond_object, bond_type, particle_name1, particle_name2): 
1054    def define_bond(self, bond_object, bond_type, particle_name1, particle_name2):
1055        """
1056        Defines a pmb object of type `bond` in `pymbe.df`
1057        
1058        Args:
1059            bond_object (`cls`): instance of a bond object from espressomd library
1060            bond_type (`str`): label identifying the used bonded potential
1061            particle_name1 (`str`): `name` of the first `particle` to be bonded.
1062            particle_name2 (`str`): `name` of the second `particle` to be bonded.
1063        
1064        Note:
1065            - Currently, only harmonic and FENE bonds are supported.
1066        """    
1067        
1068        valid_bond_types=["harmonic", "FENE"]
1069        if bond_type not in valid_bond_types:
1070                       raise ValueError(f"Bond type {bond_type} currently not implemented in pyMBE, valid types are {valid_bond_types}")
1071
1072        lj_parameters=self.get_lj_parameters(particle_name1=particle_name1, 
1073                                        particle_name2=particle_name2, 
1074                                        combining_rule='Lorentz-Berthelot')
1075
1076        cutoff = 2**(1.0/6.0) * lj_parameters["sigma"]
1077        l0 = self.calculate_initial_bond_length(bond_object=bond_object, 
1078                                                bond_type=bond_type, 
1079                                                epsilon=lj_parameters["epsilon"],
1080                                                sigma=lj_parameters["sigma"],
1081                                                cutoff=cutoff)
1082
1083        index = len(self.df)
1084        for label in [particle_name1+'-'+particle_name2,particle_name2+'-'+particle_name1]:
1085            self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=label, pmb_type_to_be_defined="bond")
1086        self.df.at [index,'name']= particle_name1+'-'+particle_name2
1087        self.df.at [index,'bond_object'] = bond_object
1088        self.df.at [index,'l0'] = l0
1089        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1090                                key=('pmb_type',''),
1091                                new_value='bond')
1092        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1093                                key=('parameters_of_the_potential',''),
1094                                new_value=self.json.dumps(bond_object.get_params()))
1095        return

Defines a pmb object of type bond in pymbe.df

Arguments:
  • bond_object (cls): instance of a bond object from espressomd library
  • bond_type (str): label identifying the used bonded potential
  • particle_name1 (str): name of the first particle to be bonded.
  • particle_name2 (str): name of the second particle to be bonded.
Note:
  • Currently, only harmonic and FENE bonds are supported.
def define_default_bond(self, bond_object, bond_type, epsilon=None, sigma=None, cutoff=None): 
1097    def define_default_bond(self, bond_object, bond_type, epsilon=None, sigma=None, cutoff=None):
1098        """
1099        Asigns `bond` in `pmb.df` as the default bond.
1100        The LJ parameters can be optionally provided to calculate the initial bond length
1101
1102        Args:
1103            bond (`obj`): instance of a bond object from the espressomd library.
1104            bond_type (`str`): label identifying the used bonded potential
1105            sigma (`float`, optional): LJ sigma of the interaction between the particles
1106            epsilon (`float`, optional): LJ epsilon for the interaction between the particles
1107            cutoff (`float`, optional): cutoff-radius of the LJ interaction
1108
1109        Note:
1110            - Currently, only harmonic and FENE bonds are supported. 
1111        """
1112        valid_bond_types=["harmonic", "FENE"]
1113        if bond_type not in valid_bond_types:
1114            raise ValueError(f"Bond type {bond_type} currently not implemented in pyMBE, valid types are {valid_bond_types}")
1115        if epsilon is None:
1116            epsilon=1*self.units('reduced_energy')
1117        if sigma is None:
1118            sigma=1*self.units('reduced_length')
1119        if cutoff is None:
1120            cutoff=2**(1.0/6.0)*self.units('reduced_length')
1121        l0 = self.calculate_initial_bond_length(bond_object=bond_object, 
1122                                                bond_type=bond_type, 
1123                                                epsilon=epsilon,
1124                                                sigma=sigma,
1125                                                cutoff=cutoff)
1126
1127        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name='default',pmb_type_to_be_defined='bond'):
1128            return
1129        if len(self.df.index) != 0:
1130            index = max(self.df.index)+1
1131        else:
1132            index = 0
1133        self.df.at [index,'name'] = 'default'
1134        self.df.at [index,'bond_object'] = bond_object
1135        self.df.at [index,'l0'] = l0
1136        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1137                            key=('pmb_type',''),
1138                            new_value='bond')
1139        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1140                            key=('parameters_of_the_potential',''),
1141                            new_value=self.json.dumps(bond_object.get_params()))
1142        return

Asigns bond in pmb.df as the default bond. The LJ parameters can be optionally provided to calculate the initial bond length

Arguments:
  • bond (obj): instance of a bond object from the espressomd library.
  • bond_type (str): label identifying the used bonded potential
  • sigma (float, optional): LJ sigma of the interaction between the particles
  • epsilon (float, optional): LJ epsilon for the interaction between the particles
  • cutoff (float, optional): cutoff-radius of the LJ interaction
Note:
  • Currently, only harmonic and FENE bonds are supported.
def define_epsilon_value_of_particles(self, eps_dict): 
1144    def define_epsilon_value_of_particles(self, eps_dict):
1145        '''
1146        Defines the epsilon value of the particles in `eps_dict` into the `pmb.df`.
1147
1148        Args:
1149            eps_dict(`dict`):  {'name': epsilon}
1150        '''
1151        for residue in eps_dict.keys():
1152            label_list = self.df[self.df['name'] == residue].index.tolist()
1153            for index in label_list:
1154                epsilon = eps_dict[residue]
1155                self.add_value_to_df(key= ('epsilon',''),
1156                        index=int (index),
1157                        new_value=epsilon)
1158        return

Defines the epsilon value of the particles in eps_dict into the pmb.df.

Arguments:
  • eps_dict(dict): {'name': epsilon}
def define_molecule(self, name, residue_list): 
1160    def define_molecule(self, name, residue_list):
1161        """
1162        Defines a pyMBE object of type `molecule` in `pymbe.df`.
1163
1164        Args:
1165            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `molecule`.
1166            residue_list (`list` of `str`): List of the `name`s of the `residue`s  in the sequence of the `molecule`.  
1167        """
1168        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='molecule'):
1169            return
1170        index = len(self.df)
1171        self.df.at [index,'name'] = name
1172        self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'molecule'
1173        self.df.at [index,('residue_list','')] = residue_list
1174        return

Defines a pyMBE object of type molecule in pymbe.df.

Arguments:
  • name (str): Unique label that identifies the molecule.
  • residue_list (list of str): List of the names of the residues in the sequence of the molecule.
def define_particle( self, name, q=0, diameter=None, acidity='inert', epsilon=None, pka=None): 
1176    def define_particle(self, name, q=0, diameter=None, acidity='inert', epsilon=None, pka=None):
1177        """
1178        Defines a pyMBE object of type `particle` in `pymbe.df`
1179
1180        Args:
1181            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `particle`.  
1182            q (`int`, optional): Charge of the `particle`. Defaults to 0.
1183            diameter (`obj`, optional): Diameter used to setup Lennard-Jones interactions for the `particle`, should have units of length using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
1184            epsilon (`obj`, optional): Epsilon parameter used to setup Lennard-Jones interactions for the `particle`, should have units of energy using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry.. Defaults to None
1185            acidity (`str`, optional): Identifies whether if the particle is `acidic` or `basic`, used to setup constant pH simulations. Defaults to `inert`.
1186            pka (`float`, optional): If `particle` is an acid or a base, it defines its  pka-value. Defaults to None.
1187        """ 
1188        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='particle'):
1189            index = self.df[self.df['name']==name].index[0]                                   
1190        else:
1191            index = len(self.df)
1192            self.df.at [index, 'name'] = name
1193            self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'particle'
1194            
1195        if diameter:
1196            self.add_value_to_df(key=('diameter',''),index=index,new_value=diameter)
1197        if epsilon:
1198            self.add_value_to_df(key=('epsilon',''),index=index,new_value=epsilon)        
1199        
1200        self.set_particle_acidity ( name=name, acidity = acidity , default_charge=q, pka=pka)
1201        return

Defines a pyMBE object of type particle in pymbe.df

Arguments:
  • name (str): Unique label that identifies the particle.
  • q (int, optional): Charge of the particle. Defaults to 0.
  • diameter (obj, optional): Diameter used to setup Lennard-Jones interactions for the particle, should have units of length using the pmb.units UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
  • epsilon (obj, optional): Epsilon parameter used to setup Lennard-Jones interactions for the particle, should have units of energy using the pmb.units UnitRegistry.. Defaults to None
  • acidity (str, optional): Identifies whether if the particle is acidic or basic, used to setup constant pH simulations. Defaults to inert.
  • pka (float, optional): If particle is an acid or a base, it defines its pka-value. Defaults to None.
def define_particles_parameter_from_dict(self, param_dict, param_name):
